dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLURRY OF MOVEMENT, WAITRESSES setting up for lunch, Slim joking with GINNY (28, knocked around but still spirited; kids at home from different guys; she somehow maintains a attitude). Slim views Ginny as her idol: for her attitude her life. Catch them in mid-conversation, Ginny slightly offended, working-class accent:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? My grandfather was a lawyer... Plus: I have a logical mind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're only like 299 thousand short of what you'd need for law school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I Piece of cake -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piece of pie -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piece of ass. So what would you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm also thinking... well ...I could go back to school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In what? I thought you hated -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Psychology maybe, I don't know. I know it's not cool to say so, but I'd like to contribute something to society, even if - (it's just)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3 GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We contribute. We give 'em food, energy, so they can go out and save Western Civilization - A bell rings, a CUSTOMER comes in, and the owner of the p PHIL (45, Syrian, also the cook) sticks his head between PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies, please. Am I paying you? GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that we noticed. (SEES CLOCK: 11:15)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, speaking.of time - The lunch rush is coming; they start working triple speed INT. "ORCA." LATER. Ginny and Slim converge carrying dirty dishes, piling the for the BUSBOY, TEDDY (21, Hispanic). They haven't stoppe moving for two hours, but now they can take a breath, sur the scene. Slim notices Ginny has a wet spot under her ar SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever try the rock, hey? GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deodorant thing. It's salts or something, it comes in like a...it looks like some kinda hippie crystal. GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're saying I sweat. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perspire, Ginny. You lightly - (PERSPIRE) GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a vow to get even) I'll remember that. (as someone comes in) Your turn, I'm sweatin' too much. Slim gives her a look, grabs a menu, goes over to where t customer, whom we will call for the moment OUR HERO, is s     4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When she reaches his booth, she notices he's got a book a long-stemmed red rose. She hands him a menu - SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting for somebody? He shakes his head. She can't help noticing he's very handsome. SLIM (CONT. Something to drink? OUR HERO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just water, thanks. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you a minute to look over - OUR HERO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. I was in yesterday... (reads her nametag) Slim. She nods, slightly uncomfortable. He hands her his menu. OUR HERO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your real name? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. OUR HERO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm. I like it, but don't you think it's kinds negative? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't tell my name. OUR HERO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Coke and a turkey burger, coleslaw no fries, couple extra slices tomato. I write books. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. OUR HERO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You read books? She kind of half-nods half-shrugs.     5

dialogues.speaker: OUR HERO, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: What're you reading now? She stares at him... SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finneaan's Wake by James Joyce. A friend told me it's the hardest book in the English Language. Not the hardest hardest, just the hardest one it's actually possible to read, and I figure if I can get through that one, I can do the others. OUR HERO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long you been reading it? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six years. I'll be back with your TB. She leaves, goes back puts the order in, mutters to Ginny

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Asshole. GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he say? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanted to find out how smart I was so I told him I was reading the hardest book in the English language. GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He likes you. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's just a dick. GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim...he was in yesterday - SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know - GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's back today with a rose, he pulls you into conversation. Honey, if you can't tell he likes you, you need to study psychology.     6 SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so he likes me. GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like him? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know him. GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that got to do with it? Slim: he is a major piece of cake/piece of pie. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't notice. GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me. Carrot cake. And when a guy like that - cuter than you? - he actually likes you - SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's cuter than me?? tinny gives her a long stare; this is obviously a favorit ROUTINE: GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Wise up, huh? No-one is ever gonna go for you 'cause of your looks. SLIM (NODS SOBERLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is bad news, 'cause my personality bites. Ginny grins. Slim writes up a check for a CUSTOMER at the counter. When she finishes, the turkey burger is up. She carries it to the table: SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TB, coleslaw, and so forth. You don't really write books, do you? OUR HERO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't read Finnecan's Wake either.     7 OUR HERO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm goin' into law. Enforcement. She nods. This is more like what she expected. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the rose for? He shrugs. She's busy, so she starts to go: SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy your grub, huh? She's seven feet away when she hears: OUR HERO HEY -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheturns back toward him - He smiles, offers the rose: OUR HERO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You. She smiles back-their eyes meet... a sudden utterly magic moment. This is also the moment to.note OUR HERO should b played by a famous actor doing a cameo. Because at this instant the scene changes. The man (MITCH) in the booth behind Our Hero - a man we h noticed because all we've seen is the back of his head - and looks at Slim. Stands. Looks down at Our Hero... MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much did you settle on? OUR HERO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse. me? Slim frowns, steps closer so she can overhear: MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bet. How much is it? Our Hero has a completely blank look on his face -

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: You and your friend. Yesterday. Was it 200 or 500 or - ?     8 SLIM (TO MITCH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you - MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bet his friend he could get in your pants in less than twelve hours, starting noon today. Our Hero rises to his feet and pushes Mitch in the chest, looks like a stupid move, since Mitch is bigger - OUR HERO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this your business? (right in Mitch's face) What are you, the morals police? He pushes again and Mitch,s hand shoots out like a snake striking. Grabs him by the collar. Lifts him. A frozen moment, more violence just a breath away, and a sense of about to spin out of control... Our Hero's eyes are poppi he tries to hide his fear: OUR HERO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy, M...man. She and I were just having some fun - SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to our Hero) Was it two hundred or five? (VERY CALM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know what I'm worth. Our Hero gestures to Mitch: would you mind putting me dow Mitch reluctantly obliges. Our Hero does his best to recollect his dignity. Looks at Slim. Drops a ten on the table and smirks: OUR HERO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bet was two, but now that I know you? Way too high. A pained look flashes across Slim's face - Our Hero starts toward the door, but Mitch steps in his p Speaks quietly but with authority; there's a physical pow his words. Since he's protecting Slim, the power is COMFORTING:     MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't come back here, buddy. Ever. Our Hero nods nervously. Mitch steps back 3 inches, just far enough to let our Her leave. Which he does with considerable relief. Slim's leaning vs. the counter, shaken, tears in her eyes Mitch tugs his baseball cap, mutters as he heads for the MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to get in your business. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Hey. Thank you. He nods, keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: (blurts out, grateful:) I... I can't believe you actually said something. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns, shrugs) If I'd kept my mouth shut, I'd'a felt bad later. Good luck, huh? She nods. He ambles out the door. A touch of the cowboy in him. She shakes her head, looks at Ginny. Ginny gestures as if to say, well? At first Slim doesn't get it. Ginny gestures more urgently: Come on. What're you waitin for? She looks toward the door - Slim follows her look. PUSH IN ON SLIM'S FACE as she trie work up the courage... Just as she starts toward the door, we: CUT TO:     10 BRIDE AND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHES:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wedding photos. Mitch has lots of (surprisingly upper cru family, Slim has a few friends. The more photos FLASH, th more pronounced (and sad), the contrast. FLY RIGHT INTO: Bacchanalian DANCING. French Champagne has flowed; shoes inhibitions were abandoned hours ago. THE CAMERA weaves through the DANCERS to find: Slim and Mitch, dancing close, never quite touching, ever intense, physical, like subtle public sex. Their eyes are locked; she runs her veil down his body, his hand lightly touches her ass; they slow down and stand, lips a millime apart but not quite kissing, the sexual tension building. We see how crazy they are about each other, how completel physically involved - and how much fun they have. Watching them is Phil, with Mitch's parents, MRS. TYLER ( confident, at ease with her power and family money, and likeable despite monstrous flaws) and MR. TYLER (someone Tyler married in a moment of cupidity).

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TYLER
dialogues.text: Mitch was kind of.. .evasive. Is her father dead too? PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead to her. He left when she was two.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TYLER
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, I'm happy to pay for the WEDDING -

dialogues.speaker: MR. TYLER
dialogues.text: Yes, we're very happy -

dialogues.speaker: MRS, TYLER
dialogues.text: (ignoring Mr. T.) It's a way to build bridges... Not that you can... (repair all the damage) When there's such a vast body of water...     11 PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't get along with your son? She gives him a look. She's both offended by, and appreci of, his bluntness. Looks out at Mitch:

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TYLER
dialogues.text: He's like my father. Which means, I guess, that he'll do very well. PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's done well to get Miss Slim.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TYLER
dialogues.text: Yes, he has, hasn't he? He's married down, but he's gotten value. As Phil reacts, he notices his wife, SALIMA, has joined h With her are two kids (5 and 2). Salima's looking out at the floor: not at Slim, but at Gi and her dance partner. We see a thought cross her mind. S bends down and whispers conspiratorially to the kids. They whoop their response, run out to Ginny (who looks qu uncomfortable in her Maid-of-Honor dress).

dialogues.speaker: FIVE YEAR OLD SON
dialogues.text: Mom! Mom! Mom! Can we spend the night at Phil and Salima's house? Ginny looks over, winks at Salima, and kisses her kids: GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't eat at their ice cream, huh? They squeal with pleasure and run off. Ginny turns back, resumes dancing with JOE (24, handsome casual way, a good guy): GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this was during college or after? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During. GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was wrong with you? (off his puzzled look) I mean-why'd you and Slim break up?     12 JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Well. I'm terrible in bed. (lets this hang for a moment for shock value, then:) Plus, I don't know: we just sort of.. . evolved into being friends. GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evolution? You were going the wrong direction, bud. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's kinda what .1 thought, but I guess I was so totally pathetic - GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why am I not believing this? (INTRIGUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I take you home right now? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you've got a sense of humor. GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My kids are out for the night, and... JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another thing: I live in Chicago; women always want the possibility of LONG-TERM - GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't propose, huh? I just want to have... (looks at him...) a brief and completely unsatisfying sexual encounter. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I'm your guy. She pulls him into a kiss, and...well: he's not a bad kis We glide from them to Slim and Mitch, hardly moving. Sudd tender and insecure and almost comic, she looks at him... SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure,you love me? MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh...     13 SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For ever and ever? He stops dancing. Senses the real issue beneath her quest MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're safe with me, Slim. You're safe, and it's okay to be happy. We deserve it. They kiss. Others stop to watch: how cute. Phil comes ove waits. When they break: PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I gotta get up five o'clock to buy green beans. He slips an envelope into Mitch's hand: PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my country, it's tradition to give money to groom. You don't need it, but... Slim shakes her head, touched, as: MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very sweet - SLIM (HUGGING PHIL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for giving me away, okay? You're the best substitute Dad a girl could possibly have. PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No substitute. I am real thing. She kisses him, and he goes. They look after him. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He really loves you. She nods, not quite picking up how odd his statement is: course he loves her; she nicked him to give her away. Mitch turns her toward him and slips his hands inside the of her dress (so the back of his hands touch her breasts; this going too far?). He pulls her to him, whispers: MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna give me babies?     14 SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How soon? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How soon can we get out of here? He hoists her into his arms and carries her off the floor Applause from the GUESTS. It's a grand romantic gesture. have to wonder if Mitch is just a little too good to be t CUT TO: CONQUERING HERO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim (4 months pregnant) stands'on the walkway leading up large, simple,' beautiful house. Mitch is knocking at the The man who answers the door is 62, white-haired, vigorou Looks like he walked out of a Viagra ad. HOME OWNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. We've been driving around, and my wife has completely fallen in love with your house. HOME OWNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's great, isn't it? MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want to buy it. The Home Owner's jaw drops as Mitch gestures toward his b WIFE:

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: My wife wants it for our family. HOME OWNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (polite but firm) Well...we're not selling. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you are.     15

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch hands him a slip of paper. Totally amiable: MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the price. Don't worry, it's well over-market. HOME OWNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned, a little scared) You... You're out of your mind. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. That's just it. So before you say no again, think how miserable one determined crazy person can make you. Miserable today, miserable tomorrow, miserable for every single day until the day you sell. We glimpse the Home Owner's will just starting to crumble

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Your kids are grown, you'll be happier in a smaller place. MOVE OFF the Owner's face... SLOW PAN TO the window of th .the SENSE that time is passing... and when we reach the window, we see SLIM inside. MOVE THROUGH the window... INT. HOUSE. KITCHEN. DAY. Six weeks later. She's happily putting away groceries. Whistling to herself. What we can see of the house feels the furnishings are simple, casual, friendly. She's putting a bottle of oil up on a shelf. . .but it ne quite gets there. Her face changes. Something's happened. The hand holding the oil lowers... the oil bottle slips t her fingers and smashes on the floor... Oil spreading across the floor... She stares at it. Claws the air, grabbing the cordless phone as she plops d a kitchen barstool. Starts to cry. Punches the autodialer SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Slim, is he there? Water is flooding down the barstool; she's miscarried.     16

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Well, will you please just... Just tell him I'm sorry, okay? CUT TO: SECOND PREGNANCY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A central area with large offices surrounding it, GUYS IN

dialogues.speaker: SUITS, GUYS IN CONSTRUCTION GEAR, ARCHITECTS, ATTRACTIVE
dialogues.text: WOMEN. . .all moving quickly, purposefully. TWO UNIFORMED come out of a room putting envelopes into their pockets. Projects everywhere. Models, photos, charts and timelines when the concrete's going to be poured, when the inspecto comes, etc. Mitch is building mini-malls. In the center of this activity, Mitch moves from one locu energy to the next: answering questions, making suggestio Gradually we perceive something, motion slower than the r the office. Slim. Coming toward him. He sees her. Sees he expression. She stops. He realizes: MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw the doctor? It's so obvious from her face that she barely needs to'sa SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lost this one too. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim lies in bed. Very pale, a light dust of sweat. We as she's between contractions. Mitch's face inches from hers smothering her with kisses. The Nurse brings the baby in, starts to give her to Slim MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I hold her? The Nurse looks at Slim,. who nods, and gives Mitch the b     17

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her head, dances with her. Slim looks adoringly at father and daughter: the sight is almost unbelievably sweet. His cell phone rings. He keeps dancing, ignoring it. After one ring, it stops. He's kissing the baby's head over and over, just like he Slim, and staring into the infant's eyes - MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks just like my baby pictures. His cell phone rings again. As if the previous call had b signal. Slim looks at him as the phone keeps ringing. With some difficulty, juggling the baby, he turns the pho off. But he doesn't look at Slim. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that? MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Who cares? Some construction thing, I guess. She stares at him. He stares at the baby. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't she the most beautiful thing you ever saw in your life? Slim nods cautiously. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remains of a picnic. Slim's playing with their daughter, GRACIE, now 4. Says something and Gracie laughs. Slim lau     IS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keeps laughing, which really gets Gracie going. Mitch loo on, tries to join in, but it's forced-and besides that: they're not even looking at him, not inviting his laughte it's all between the mother and child. So he stops trying. Just watches them. And before his eye they become - for an instant - strangers. As this reactio and the subtle hostility it engenders, flicker across his Slim looks up at him - For one long moment they both seem to acknowledge the gul between them... Then Gracie says something. Slim turns back toward her, t "girls" are laughing again...and Mitch is not. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOWER STALL. Glass, opaque, streaked with water and soap as to give a slightly freaky aspect. Someone inside. Slim watching. Smiles. Starts to take off her clothes. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. SLIM (FLIRTATIOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I join you? MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm about to get out. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (down to her panties) Oh. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go to back to work, I'm just doing this to wake myself up. SLIM (DISAPPOINTED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. (starts to go)     19 MITCH (CALLS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. SLIM (TO HERSELF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (Me too.) She's in the bedroom now. It's underlit, full of shadows. scary-movie nomenclature, she's exposed, vulnerable; it f like someone's going to leap out and attack her at any - Not this time. She throws on shorts and a t-shirt - INT. HALL. NIGHT. She looks in on Gracie, sleeping peacefully. Consoling im INT. KITCHEN. NIGHT. She's washing dishes, bored, humming to herself. The coun covered with take-out food containers: she didn't cook. A noise. Pager. Not beeping, just humming slightly: she wouldn't even hear it except it's on the tile counter. Sounds vaguely like a vibrator. Lying there, just a few f from her. With Mitch's wallet and keys, his cell phone. She looks at it. .knows she shouldn't... decides not to.. Can't resist. Dries her.hands methodically on a dishtowel Picks up the pager. Reads: 33. She stares, realizing: it's code. She looks at the cell phone. Wonders whether... Looks toward the hall. We HEAR the shower still running.. She picks up his cell phone. Tentatively - she's not sure will work - she presses: RECALL 33. The phone flashes NAME, but instead of a name there's: . She stares at this, glances again down the hall-takes a d breath.. .and presses SEND. Waits... listens nervously...     20 WOMAN'S VOICE (FLIRTATIOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello there. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just paged my husband, right? (HALF BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch. (HALF BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you, what's your name? WOMAN'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I - SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late to deny it. Tell me your - (name) A rustle on the other end -

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Don't hang upl Don't be a cowardl Silence.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Just your name. That's the least you could do, don't you think? A simple plea, one woman to another... WOMAN'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm...Darcelle. Not only the name. Now we hear it in the accent: she's Fr Dialtone. Slim goes into slow motion. How oddly her arm moves downw She looks at the phone. Blinks. Presses OFF. Scans the room as if she's never seen it before. One of Gracie's toys lies on the floor. Slim stares at it Reaches down to pick it up, but instead of the toy moving her body moves down. She slumps to the floor. Sits. Stare WIDER ANGLE. MINUTES LATER. Slim sitting on the floor. Frozen. Head bowed.     21

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch comes out, dressed, sees her. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. She doesn' t say anything. He approaches her. Some instinct keeps him from speaking. sees she's holding his phone, the silly toy... SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you do this to Gracie? He doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Darcelle paged you. That' s where you're going, right? (off his silence) Yeah. Wow. Mitch? Can you please? Can you sit here with me? He does. She doesn't know where to start, how to talk about it... SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's French? MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She isn't important. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're important. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Gracie. She nods. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch?, I can't... I couldn't stand for this to... (destroy our lives) I'm happy, I've really been happy, and I don't want to - (give that up)     22 MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't have to. Believe me. She's nothing, she's no-one - SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... Damn it! You said I was safe with you! MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are, Slim. You are. I promise. They fall into an embrace. We feel how keenly they need e other. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're hugging. Begin TIGHT on them. At first it seems l this is the same embrace shot from a different angle. The see we're in the kitchen, his briefcase is at his side; t clothes are different.

dialogues.speaker: SING A SAD SONG
dialogues.text: We watch Slim's expression slowly change. From pleasure. confusion. Pain. Outrage. She whispers: SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I smell her. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her perfume. Darcelle or whoever. MITCH SLIM - SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intense, sad) How many, Mitch? How many are there? How many have there been? MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it matter? A stunning statement. Even more stunning because of the c way he says it.     23

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: ID I mean what're you saying here, that I don't deserve to get laid? Please. I'm a man, Slim. With the pregnancies, Gracie, you don't have time and energy like you used to, and I understand that, I really do. Men and women have different needs, and that's okay. Darcelle is willing to take care of it, and maybe that's better for everybody. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Including you? He contemplates his answer...and shrugs. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No! No! MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, Slim - Wild, violently invading his space and assaulting his aut screaming at him, her face just inches from his: I SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this anymore! I can't! Just take it, and take it, and take it!? I'm not strong enough! I don't know who would be. I love you, okay? I love you and I'm your wife and you can't do this! You understand me?!!! No more! No more! With the same speed he attacked "Our Hero" at the diner, Mitch's hand shoots out like a snake striking. Slaps her. A warning: stop it and stop it now. Her face: shock. Confusion. Outrage. She raises her hand her cheek. Touches her skin where his fist landed... He reads her expression and is almost amused: MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, I can't hit you? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low, strong) No. You can't. He hits her again, this time with a closed fist.     24

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knocking her to the ground. Stands over her like a boxer. Sees rase flare across her face - MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to fight? I'm a mom, honey; it's no contest. She's silent, but we see (very small) her reaction: Oh ye

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: You have to understand, Slim. I thought you did: make the money here, so I set the rules, right? It's my rules. He waits for her response, but again she's silent. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You with me? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your rules. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. She keeps her voice meek so as not to offend: SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I don't like the rules?? MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't "like" them?! She nods cautiously.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Come on. Life isn't onl stuff we like. We take the good with the bad, right? That's what life is, what marriage is. So maybe, for you, today is a bad day. Tomorrow may be great. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow may be great. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.     25 SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow will be great. (Without you . ) He appears to miss her inference. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Today is the price you pay for having such a good life. She stares at him. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going out. She says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: This is gonna be better, don't you think? She just cannot process the absurdity of this statement.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: I don't have to sneak around, pretend I'm going to work. I can just say: "I'm going to Darcelle's, I'll be back in a few hours." Her face is completely blank. He bends down, gives her a kiss on the head. We feel her crawl. She watches him go. Waits. Hears the front door close. She gets up, walks to the window, watches him walk toward car. She turns away, looks at the room. We HEAR his car start. She goes to the phone. Thinks. Starts to dial-slowly, deliberately... Shock: RAP AT THE WINDOW! He's there.     26

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reacts with guilt, but he doesn't look angry now. Beh him is his idling Mercedes convertible, driver's door ope He motions for her to open the window. She does. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who you calling? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you gonna tell her? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm supposed to bring Gracie tomorrow. Maybe I better cancel. MITCH (NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking. You...you know that I adore you, but if you ever want...if you want out... For a second he can't talk. He's choked up. She watches coldly. His emotion appears real, but who car

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: .I'll understand. I really will. (ALMOST TENDER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's one thing: you can't have Gracie. She's my daughter. Don't even think about taking her. Slim stares at him. He adds calmly:

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: If I see that thought even cross your mind, I'll kill you. There. He's said what he needs to. He walks toward his ca She shuts the window. Stares after him. In an odd and defiant way, she starts to whistle. Loudly. To herself. Almost daring him.     27

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps walking. CUT TO: OUTTA HERE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emotional, impressionistic. CLOSE ON her face, almost ins her skin: a visual symphony. The countryside behind her i of focus, a blur. She pulls up at a gate, punches in a co Drives up a long a driveway to: EXT. PASADENA ESTATE. DAY. FOUR JAGUARs lined up. At a respectful distance sit an ol Toyota (the maid's car) and a pick-up (the gardener's tru Slim parks near the truck. Her hand moves to the door handle, but she can't bring he to open it. She sits... paralyzed, a failure. In this prolonged pause, Mrs. Tyler bursts out of the hou

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TYLER
dialogues.text: You're late, you're late, I was worried you wouldn't comet (looks, realizes) No Gracie? Slim shakes her head. Mrs. Tyler is clearly disappointed, but quickly covers it

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TYLER
dialogues.text: Well then, you and I will have a girls' luncheon and gossip about simply everybody! She's about to hurtle into the gossip when Slim turns her and Mrs. Tyler sees (and we see for the first time) the r of Mitch's brutality: a nasty bruise on Slim's cheek. Mrs. Tyler's face falls as she realizes what this means. Underneath it all, she's a warm person; she hugs Slim:

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TYLER
dialogues.text: Oh baby. Oh baby, I'm so sorry...     28

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLD a moment; like a mother-daughter tableau... Her tone stays sympathetic, not at all accusatory:

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TYLER, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: What did you do? What'd you say to him? Slim freezes. On her sad, shocked reaction - CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginny in the middle of an intense rap. She and Slim are w in a corner booth. The off-season lunch rush has died dow GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men are land mines. Some you trigger the first week, others it's years in. Problem is: you want a man man, meaning his veins run thick with testosterone, which is good 'cause he can fuck your brains out but he can also turn around, no warning, and beat your brains out too. PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never touch Salima. Ginny waves at him: of course not. PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the other part, first part: I can - (do that) GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Phil. Nobody's talkin' about your dick here, okay? Phil brings Slim an iced tea and slice of pie: PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You went to cops, I hope? GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Don't be stupid.) Mitch is in construction, Phil. SLIM (NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows every cop in the city.     29 GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if he didn't. My aunt? She got a restraining order? When it was up, this slimeball beat her into a coma. PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he wants to put her in coma, why worry restraining order? GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause he's a man, Phil! He's psychotic! (calmly, to Slim) You're leaving him today. Right now. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes her head, trapped) I gotta pick up Gracie at pre-school. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE 4-YEAR-OLD GIRLS running toward a car, squealing. They're all blond and adorable, and it takes a moment for realize none of them is Gracie. Slim sits in her car in the pick-up line. The Four Girls in the Volvo station wagon in front of her. The Volvo pulls out, and Slim moves to the front of the l The very hip PRE-SCHOOL DIRECTOR smiles at Slim: PRESCHOOL DIRECTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your husband got her. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What??

dialogues.speaker: PRESCHOOL DIRECTOR, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Gracie was totally psyched. I told him he should do it more often. Slim nods with feigned casualness and pulls away. Slight frozen on her face. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls in. No other car there.     30

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around. Nothing abnormal except the quiet. As i they've gone and are never coming back. She digs out her cell phone, punches the first number on automatic dialer. Presses SEND. Thinks. After one ring, she disconnects. Immediately presses RECALL, then SEND. HE ANSWERS: MITCH'S VOICE (FOR DARCELLE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is my little croissant? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your loaf of bread. MITCH'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerful, no guilt) Oh. Hi. How's it going? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you? MITCH'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoo. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me you were going to - (pick up Gracie) MITCH'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called you at home, left messages - He's interrupted by a LOUD SQUEAL from Gracie, followed b question, which he answers:

dialogues.speaker: MITCH'S VOICE, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Your Mom. GRACIE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Moml The elephants are peeing! MITCH'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleased with himself for being a good Dad) She's a little excited.     31 SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are you coming home? CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner. It's scary that Mitch will have this conversation front of Gracie, who's playing at their feet: MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It made me nervous when I couldn't reach you. Slim shrugs. He stares at her. Smiles. His voice so soft and calm:

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea how bad things can get? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Educate me. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed to say it) Slim. I'm a determined person. I was determined to have you, and I did. This house...the company...I am, and always will be, a person who gets what he wants. You can either share in my success or leave us (meaning him and Gracie) right now. Which way you wanna go? Beat. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to be happy. He's not sure of her subtext, but he's willing to give he benefit of the doubt : MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. With a sudden shock, Slim sees Gracie staring at Mitch: t girl has picked up on his tone. Slim glances at Mitch to see if he notices Gracie's expre He doesn't.     32

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim looks back at Gracie: still staring at Mitch. If she already senses what's happening, how long before she's af by it? How long before she sees Mitch become violent? Slim's jaw tightens slightly; her resolve grows stronger. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch asleep, Slim awake, listening. His breathing deep, rhythmic, slight hint of a snore. In the distance, a DOVE coos. She looks at her clock: 2:15. She eases out of bed. Goes into the bathroom. We hear the sound of her peeing. INT. BATHROOM. She's no peeing. A BOTTLE is propped up, running water in the toilet as Slim gets dressed. Quickly, silently. INT. BEDROOM. NIGHT. She leans out the bathroom doorway, sees: he's still asle She moves quickly, bathroom to hall. INT. GRACIE'S ROOM. NIGHT. Gracie's fast asleep. Slim lifts her up, piles her prized teddy bear on top. INT. HALL. NIGHT. Slim carries Gracie toward the entrance. We MOVE with her She's silent, terrified. Glances over her shoulder - No one there. She keeps walking. The eerie sense of a house that's awak rather than asleep. The almost imperceptible but anxiety- provoking SWOOSH of her footsteps... EXTEND the suspense long as we possibly can...     33

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches the front door. Waits to make sure all is quiet. It is. She turns, looks back down the hall. Empty. Reaches toward the doorknob... hand closer, closer... she to turn it - EXT. SLIM'S HOUSE. NIGHT. Ginny, Phil, and Teddy are clustered under a tree, starin the house. Waiting. Their VAN is parked down the road. We expect the front door to open any instant. It doesn't. They wait. Casually. Not knowing where Slim was. But we know. Did something go wrong? Slim was right at th door. In a casual way, her rescuers start to wonder. TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she didn't hear the signal. GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heard it. PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Teddy's right. She could still be asleep - GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not asleep, okay? She's coming out any second. Phil nods. They wait. She does not come out. Ginny shakes her head, looks at her watch.     34 GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it again. Teddy nods. Cups his hands, coos like a dove... They wait again. Beat. INT. HOUSE. NIGHT. Slim still frozen in exactly the same spot. Still carryin Gracie, still with her hand on the knob. Listening. Turni her head this way-that way. She hears the COOING DOVE NOI come again from outside. That settles it. She pulls the door -

dialogues.speaker: MITCH FLYING AT HER -
dialogues.text: Grabs her, catches her, catches Gracie, pulling Slim's ha hard, leading her away from the door - EXT. HOUSE. NIGHT. The three rescuers still wait. Frozen. Phil shakes his head. We see a baseball bat in his hands. PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We better go in. GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'd be crazy to wake him. If anything's wrong, she'll flick the lights. .Right? Phil nods skeptically, and Ginny herself doesn't seem so They look at the house-and wait. . .and wait... We want t scream: "GO IN! GO! SAVE HER!" Suddenly something. Subtle. Was that A SOUND from inside? They go on alert. . .step forward... listen more closely. But hear nothing unusual.     35

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil. looks at Ginny, shrugs - Ginny shrugs back - FLASH OF LIGHT, then darkness. The signal. They run toward the house - SCREAM. Slim. Intense horrible spit of sound, replaced by even more horrible silence. Deadly silence. CLOSE ON GINN they run: as if we've lost Slim and Ginny's.our new protagonist. As we near the house, we realize: it's not silence. There are sounds from inside: almost inaudible T Sound of a beating. On Ginny's horrified reaction - Baseball bat. Phil smashes a window. They climb through the hole into the house - INT. HOUSE. NIGHT. Silence. They move quickly, carefully toward the living r it's very dark, we can hardly - MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another step and you're dead. Mitch emerges from darkness. Light glints off his pistol. Thirty feet behind him: Gracie's sleeping on the couch. Mitch moves and they stare in horror. Lying at his feet i Slim's body.. Pain springs from Ginny's throat, she rushes to Slim - Mitch rams the gun into her head: MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you hear me?i Ginny feels Slim's pulse, says to Phil: GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's alive - MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless you go, your brains'11 be on imy rug i     36 PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir. We are three people. If you kill us all, you will go sure to electric chair. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could give a shit. Slim makes a SOUND as Ginny strokes her head... Mitch FIRES the gun into the wall over Ginny's head. Muff sound: silencer. But he has everyone's attention now:

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: This is your last chance. PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are happy to leave, Sir: with Miss Slim and Gracie. Ginny's helping Slim to her knees.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: And make no mistakes. If you keep them here, we will go to police, who will arrest you with pleasure. I/

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch stares at Phil. Walks to him. Is he going to hit hi Shoot him? Mitch leans in, gun to Phil's head, and whispe MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to say this in front of the group, but you're just a rug-head, nobody'll believe you. You go to the cops, it's her word against mine. They'll find drugs in her bureau... (before Phil can laugh) Or her car, whatever. (VERY STRONG)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me on that. (casual, confident) I'll have custody of Gracie by the end of the week. PHIL (SKEPTICAL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if we take them away, you will shoot all four of us?? MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.     37 PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we die young. The others are uncertain, but Phil helps Slim up; Teddy j him. Ginny tentatively follows his lead and picks up Grac SLIM (VERY SOFT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (This is no good.) You're humiliating him. GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little louder) He'll come after me and kill me. Mitch overhears this, smiles. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear that? That's why she loves me. (off their horrified looks) Nobody cares like I do. The others stare at him in astonishment, but continue tow the door. Mitch leans toward Slim, whispers: MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you soon. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gracie awake now in Slim's arms: staring, confused. Gentl rocking of the van. The others barely visible, like shado

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gracie asleep, Slim holding her. Blinds down, movie playi Despite Gracie's age, the angle and soft lighting make th resemble a Madonna and child... CUT TO:     38

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open air market: shops, stalls; yuppie heaven. Slim carri Gracie on her shoulders. They're with Jog (her old boyfri from the wedding). Horsing around, having a good time, Gr eating a pastry. They stop and look out at Lake Michigan. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow ... whattaya think, Toots? GRACIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a big ocean! JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. It's only a lake, but we like it. GRACIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, stares out... Can we stay here a while? CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're driving along, suddenly Joe says - JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming up, whattaya say?! GRACIE & SLIM (A GAME)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobbing for apples! Slim (front seat) and Gracie (back) both drop their heads they can't be seen from outside the car - Joe turns the corner, presses a garage door opener, and d into the basement garage of a nice-looking 4-plex. INT. JOE'S 4-PLEX. NIGHT. They come in from the garage, throw off their coats. All curtains in the apartment are drawn. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anybody who likes ice cream? Gracie whoops - The doorbell rings -     39

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim and Joe freeze - Slim whips her hand over Gracie's mouth - Gracie looks horrified: why are you covering my - Slim puts her finger to her mouth: shhh. She takes Gracie's hand; they scurry out of sight - Joe hurries to the stereo, puts it on. Music to cover Gra "whoop . " He goes to the door, looks through the peep hole. Sees a LARGE MAN IN A SUIT. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: FIRST FBI MAN
dialogues.text: FBI. Can we talk? He holds up an I.D. Not readable through the peep hole. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST FBI MAN
dialogues.text: Would you mind opening up? Joe glances over his shoulder: no sign of them. He opens door, but not far enough to let the man in. Behind the la man are TWO OTHER MEN IN SUITS.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST FBI MAN
dialogues.text: We're investigating a kidnapping; we'd like to look around. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a search warrant?

dialogues.speaker: FIRST FBI MAN
dialogues.text: Oh, we got a warrant all right. He slaps a paper and pushes past Joe; the other men follo JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I she the warrant? First FBI Man ignores this.     40

dialogues.speaker: JOE, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Who're you looking for? The FBI Man gives him a sarcastic glance.

dialogues.speaker: JOE, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: A mother taking her own child isn't kidnapping. I don't think you're FBI at all. This elicits no response. Joe moves to where he can see t other two guys. Looks down the hall toward: INT. KITCHEN. NIGHT. SECOND FBI MAN searching the pantry, looking around. He opens the door to the garage and vanishes - INT. BEDROOM. NIGHT. THIRD FBI MAN looks under the bed, in the closets... yank clothes aside. At any moment we expect him to find them.. INT. LIVING ROOM. NIGHT. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister: unless you leave right now, I'm calling the police.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST FBI MAN
dialogues.text: Oh...jeez...that's a scary thought. Joe picks up the phone - First FBI Man slams it down.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST FBI MAN
dialogues.text: I marri a cop, okay? I'm not in the mood. Joe accepts this. . .but only for the moment. INT. GARAGE. NIGHT. Second FBI Man looks in the car, under the car... isn't t logical place for them to hide???     41

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Third FBI Man returns from the bedroom emptyhanded, start search the living room:

dialogues.speaker: THIRD FBI MAN
dialogues.text: I'll look around here? INT. KITCHEN. NIGHT. The Second FBI Man returns from the garage, starts to sea We're scared with every cupboard he opens that he'll find INT. LIVING ROOM. NIGHT. Third FBI Man searches the room. SUDDENLY we go to SLIM'S POV...she and Gracie are in a ca looking out through a narrow horizontal slit. Watching th Third FBI Man makes his way methodically in their directi First FBI Man stands over Joe, keeping him silent. Joe watches the Third FBI Man search the room... And then Joe blinks. Moves his eyes, and looks right in S direction. He realizes where they must be hiding. The Third FBI Man's getting closer and closer to them... Joe realizes he has to do something. Abruptly Joe stands: JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough. (VERY FORCEFUL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear me? It's time to go. Now. (off First FBI's. shocked look) I know who you are, okay? I know who hired you. First FBI Man whirls. Suddenly he's got a knife in his ha Definitely NOT FBI. Putting the. knife to Joe's throat:

dialogues.speaker: "FIRST FBI MAN"
dialogues.text: Yeah? You know what it feels like to have a knife hit your carotid? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying not to move) No.     42

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the cabinet, Gracie gasps. Slim puts a hand over h mouth. But Slim herself has to fight the impulse to burst of there to save Joe -

dialogues.speaker: "FIRST FBI MAN"
dialogues.text: You know what it's like to bleed out in less than two minutes? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: "THIRD FBI MAN"
dialogues.text: (stopping his search) Oh please, John Boy. Not the shiv AGAIN -

dialogues.speaker: "FIRST FBI MAN"
dialogues.text: I'm just going to cut him a little - Slim's eyes bulge -

dialogues.speaker: "THIRD FBI MAN"
dialogues.text: You are not going to cut him!

dialogues.speaker: "FIRST FBI MAN"
dialogues.text: I sure as hell am! Slim's on the verge of bursting out when "Second FBI" ent

dialogues.speaker: "SECOND FBI MAN"
dialogues.text: John Boy, this is not listed on the program. Come on, they're not here; let's ride.

dialogues.speaker: "FIRST FBI MAN"
dialogues.text: Can't I just - (cut him a little}

dialogues.speaker: "SECOND FBI MAN"
dialogues.text: No! No slice and dice! They head for the door. As he goes, "First FBI Man" (a.k.a. John Boy) runs his kn along the couch, spilling out its contents... .passes the tv set and stabs the tube... .runs his knife along the wall, making a vicious scary ma And they vanish. We hear the door SLAM. The horizontal band through which Slim was looking widens     43

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cabinet door falls open, Slim and Gracie come out. Gracie's crying. Slim hugs her, says to Joe: SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, are you okay? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess. (feels his neck) I needed a shave, anyway. The phone rings. They look at it. It can't be who they think it is... it rings again. Joe goes to it. Hesitates. Answers: JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? MITCH'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Mitch Tyler, Joe. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, yes, how are you? Joe points at phone: "It's him." He nods toward Gracie, indicating Slim should take her into the next room. Slim MITCH'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calm, friendly) I assume Slim's called you. Joe thinks for a split second, then: JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. MITCH'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you give her a message? (off his silence) If she calls again, I mean. Slim and Gracie are in the next room, but Slim's looking through the door back at Joe. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'm on her side here, not yours.     44 MITCH'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her side? Come on, Joe, you're a smart person. Let me say two words, okay? "Lug nuts." You don't want to worry they're loose every time you get in your car. And how 'bout the windows to your apartment: are they still locked? A person could go crazy thinking about stuff like that. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Mitch. MITCH'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her to call her friends. Joe hangs up. Slim comes back out. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Charming. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scare you? Joe shakes his head - more at Mitch than in answer to her question.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I shouldn't be here - JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you should - SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm dangerous to know right now. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calm, forceful) Slim. You can be here anytime. She nods. They both know what he's saying: if he's willin take this kind of risk, he's either a very good friend (w he is) or he's still in love with her (which he is, also)

dialogues.speaker: JOE, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Oh. He said you should call your friends. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the restaurant?     45

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER.
dialogues.text: Slim on the phone, listening as the phone rings. And agai again. Joe watching her, concerned. Finally: GINNY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awright already! Orcal SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Gin. You okay? GINNY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had to clear the customers out, some ridiculous bomb threat - SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? INT. "ORCA" RESTAURANT. NIGHT. Ginny on the cordless; Phil working nearby - GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right during dinner. Like anybody's gonna bomb a diner in Carpenteria. SLIM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you and Phil, did you - GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Phil. He won't leave his ship. We're doin' cleanup. SLIM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out. GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? SLIM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a bad feeling, Gin. GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got more than a bad feeling, hon. You got a bad husband. SLIM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know! That's what I'm saying! Get Phil and get out of there! Nowt     46 GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right, take it easy - (GRABBING PHIL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go - PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police are - GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heading out the door) Screw the police, we're outta here. SLIM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run, okay?t Ginny?! Runt EXT. "ORCA." NIGHT. They step out. The restaurant is at the end of a long pie Ginny turns skeptically to the overweight Phil - GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you run? PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Michael Jackson! As they sprint, sort of, toward the boardwalk: GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Michael Johnson, Phil. PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But I run like Michael Jackson. And he kind of does: arms flailing, not quite connected t body. Just as when we're enjoying this comic sight - EXPLOSION behind them - They're thrown TOWARD CAMERA - Debris flying everywhere - They lie on the. ground. Not moving. Are they dead or jus stunned? Slowly they raise their heads. Blink. Look back at the restaurant: Starting to go up in flames.     47

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim holding her phone. Peculiar expression on her face. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line went dead. Joe stares at her, concerned. She presses redial, and we hear THE PHONE start to ring.. She- goes to the window, parts the curtain: OUTSIDE in th street, the FBI MEN sit in their car - No answer on the phone. Slim looks at Joe and shakes her this isn't good. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim walking a crowded street, carrying Gracie; TransAmer Pyramid in the b.g. SAN FRANCISCO. Slim goes down an alle behind a converted warehouse, enters a basement garage. INT. OFFICE LOFT. DAY. One floor, lots of windows, lots of ATTRACTIVE young peop jeans working on lots of different projects. Sign on the says: V.C.V.C. Viet Cong Venture Capital. A BLOND GIRL, 2 nudges JUPITER SLAKOWSKI (52, ponytail, handsome, confide BLONDE GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Jupe. Girl here says she's your daughter. Jupiter gives Slim and Gracie a skeptical look. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you don't want to see me or know about me, but I am desperate, I had nowhere else to go...I need your belg! (off his blank look) You want me dead? He shrugs affably and leads her into his office - JUPITER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a good gig. To claim I'm your father? What year were you born?     48 SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are my Dad, Jupiter. When Mom died, I wrote you, you didn't answer. I didn't have enough money to bury her, that was really fun. JUPITER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look at me, I didn't kill her. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you had help. JUPITER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a stupid thing to say. What do you want, money?. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you should meet your granddaughter. JUPITER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perfunctory, to Gracie) Hi. Gracie looks at him skeptically, nods. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And yes, we need money. To survive. JUPITER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look sweetheart. From '68 to like '72, I had maybe 5 kids. Different women. It was like a joke to me.  SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like a joke to me too. JUPITER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the third to show up here with a hand out. I give all of you the same thing. (taking it from his wallet) Six bucks. Enough for a sandwich. For you, it's' twelve, you can buy the kid a sandwich too. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned...} Well. Now I know. JUPITER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.     49 SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Used to be if I did something nasty, my temper got the better of me?, I'd wonder where the hell it came from. Thanks for clearing that up. JUPITER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. She goes, leaving the $12 on the table. He pockets it. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim stands behind Jupiter's building. In the shadows. St carrying Gracie. It's only after we hear Gracie - GRACIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't cry, Mom. Please don't cry. - that we realize Slim is crying.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: You have mtg. Beat. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim and Gracie climb off the train and are immediately shepherded away by TWO SWARTHY MEN in Hawaiian shirts - SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Wait. What're you...? Who're you...? GRACIE (WORRIED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy? One of the Swarthy Men speaks to Slim, but in the flurry, can't hear it. She looks relieved, turns to Gracie - - but before Slim can speak, their bags are thrown in the of a car and they're pushed into the back seat - The car speeds off, whips into a left-hand turn -     50

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the car makes a right-hand turn, and a TRUCK pulls ou blocking traffic so no one can follow them - INT. CAR. NIGHT. Slim looks out the back, sees the Truck's maneuver. Turns to face forward again. Tries to meet the Driver's eyes. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Where are we going? The Driver answers her in a Middle-Eastern language. Gracie looks alarmed. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Sweetheart, they're friends of Phil's. (I think.) EXT. MOTEL IN THE WOODS. NIGHT. J

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gracie plays as Slim talks to Ginny and Phil. The car's p below. Phil gestures toward the Driver, who'e standing gu PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .so secret we don't even know who this man is or where he takes you. Slim nods. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not afraid to help me? PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my country people bleed their enemies to death out of their genitals. A fire? This is for roasting lamb. GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No letters, Slim, but you can call US - PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be very short.     51

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim nods. Phil ceremonially hands her a thin envelope. S looks inside... and clearly finds money - SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Phil, wait a minute, I - PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have insurance from fire - SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but - PHIL (VERY FIRMLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not discus, okay? We are family! She nods. Gratefully. Ginny takes her hand. Beat. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the police? The fire. Do they - PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mitch - of course - he has beautiful alibi. Slim nods again. Looks at Ginny...who's been working up t GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I keep having a bad idea. The first time he hit you, we saw your bruises. Second time, he beat you unconscious. The next time? Well. If you should fight back, defend yourself, and he dies? Who'd convict you? Who'd prosecute? PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is American law??l GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called my cousin, he's some shit- for-brains lawyer over in Tarzana, he says it's 2-1 she'd walk: self- defense, justifiable homicide. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2? That's good on a race-horse, Gin, but for Gracie?, to lose both parents? Besides, this is me, i couldn't kill anybodyl     52 GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're talking about Mitch here. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even so. I'm not that kind of person, okay? Ginny nods reluctantly. She's not sure the subject is clo CUT TO: NEW LEAF

dialogues.speaker: FLASHES, (LIKE THE CREDIT SEQUENCE)
dialogues.text: MICROFICHE, NEWSPAPER DEATH NOTICE, "Erin Shleeter, 6 wee SLIM at COUNTY RECORDER'S DESK: SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I lost my birth certificate - BIRTH CERTIFICATE for Erin Shleeter in Slim's hand - SOCIAL SECURITY CARD, in her hand - DRIVER'S LICENSE, with Slim's photo: her hair's a differe color and she wears glasses. The name is Erin Shleeter,. DRESS SHOP: new clothes, new outfits, new look, new Slim INT. LARGE DRAB HOUSE. DAY. "Erin" & Gracie being led by MUSTAPHA (40) past QUASI ARABS;, finally ending in a corner of a large room where small mattresses lie on the floor. Somewhere in Colorado. MUSTAPHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, this is the best we can -

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: It's fine, thanks. Mustapha shrugs apologetically, leaves. Gracie whispers: GRACIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom...who are all those people? SLIM/"ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're kind of...friends of Phil's. GRACIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stares at her mother) They're strangers.     53

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mustapha working at one desk, "Erin" at another. Gracie o floor, coloring. Bored. Prompts a look from "Erin" - "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. I have to find the right place and get you admitted, okay? INT. DRAB HOUSE. NIGHT. 15 people being served from a large pot. "Erin" and Graci each get a good portion of something that looks quite unu "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. GRACIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. (looks at it, whispers) What j it?

dialogues.speaker: "ERIN."
dialogues.text: Food. INT. DOUBLE "A" RENT-A-CAR. DAY. "Erin" works at her desk. Gracie shoots paper basketballs the wastebasket.. stops as Mustapha enters. He gives "Eri open FedEx pack. MUSTAPHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FedEx is like underground railroad. "Erin" is stunned. She looks inside the package, finds an FedEx pack. Opens that. Inside it is a wrapped present and note. She reads: JUPITER'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dear Daughter - (CONT.) INT. JUPITER'S OFFICE. DAY. Jupiter's at his desk as the THREE "FBI MEN" are shown in says something gracious to them. For. a moment they don't respond. Then one of them speaks     54

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever he's saying produces a subtle but profound chang Jupiter's features.

dialogues.speaker: JUPITER'S VOICE, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Yesterday three men threatened to kill me if I helped you in any way. Fortunately for you, this aroused my interest. (CONT.) INT. DOUBLE "A" RENT-A-CAR. DAY. "Erin" opens the present and finds: Cash. Fifties. Probab couple thousand dollars. She fights the impulse to cry.

dialogues.speaker: JUPITER'S VOICE, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: I'm sending this via your former boss. If you get it and need more, leave word at my office. JUPITER" CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHES:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arab Men carrying in a couch as "Erin" watches. "Erin" hanging sheets over the windows: makeshift curtain "Erin" fixing Gracie's room. Small bed. Two new Teddy Bea "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think, you like this place? GRACIE (SUSPICIOUSLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, are we moving again? "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we just - (got here) GRACIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. 'Cause I am sick and tired to death of movingi "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. So here's the deal. Try to remember,. while we're here, to call me Mom or Erin, but not Slim, okay?     55 GRACIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never call you Slim. "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but... GRACIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you are that slim. "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot. GRACIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I get a new name too? "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess. If you want one... Gracie stares at her blankly. GRACIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a crood idea . CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Erin" approaches BETTY, Director of the Pre-School: "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Betty? Hi, I'm Erin Shleeter, I called you - BETTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi - "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my daughter. BETTY (TO GRACIE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at you!, you're so...(cute) What's your name? GRACIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen Elizabeth. Betty blinks. "Erin" shrugs: that's my daughter! CUT TO:     56

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scissors. "Erin" cutting her hair in some odd primitive w that further changes her look. For the worse. INT. DOUBLE "A" RENT-A-CAR. BACK ROOM. DAY. T.T. (the African-American woman who works there) watches "Erin" exit the bathroom and put away the scissors. Not a COMPLIMENT:

dialogues.speaker: T.T.
dialogues.text: Whatever you're goin' for, girl: you're really getting there. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Erin" driving, nervous. Gracie/"Queen E."" is turned aro her seat, looking out the back -

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE/"QUEEN ELIZABETH"
dialogues.text: He is not - "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he is -

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE/""QUEEN ELIZABETH"
dialogues.text: Mom, he turned. "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turned? (looks in rear view) Oh my God, you're right. He turned. Wells (That's better.) "QUEEN ELIZABETH"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I've been saying. There are other cars, okay? Just 'cause somebody's behind you doesn't mean - (stops ...blinks...) Mom? You just drove past my school. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Erin" and "Queen E." leaving work, bickering:     57 "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I can cook something. "QUEEN ELIZABETH"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or we can go to McDonalds. "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't afford to eat out every night. I can cook, Tootster. "Queen E." rolls her eyes as: BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. (off her blank look) I'm Brad Zall, I just rented a car from you guys. "Erin" stares at him. An insane moment of sustained paran Who is this guy,. really? What does he want? Finally she realizes a normal response is required. Kind TRICK QUESTION: "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the vehicle all right? BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's fine. I was just thinking that if you're not doing anything, maybe I could buy you - and the kid of course - "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?! Who sent you?! You want a date?! You are totally out of your mind if you think I'm gonna have even this conversation we're having right now! I'm not, okay?! We are not talking! Get it?! BRAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I get it. And good luck with your psychotherapy. He walks away. She stares after him. Again "Queen E." is looking at her mother in astonishment. SUP     58 "ERIN" (STILL AGGRESSIVE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You're thinking I over- reacted? Huh? Just a little? CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Erin" driving too fast. Her slight recklessness adds an undercurrent of anxiety to the scene. She's also eating doughnuts, sharing a box with her daughter. They pass a gas station. "Queen E." sees pay phones. "QUEEN ELIZABETH"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Mom? I like the doughnuts and all, but the driving... "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get on my case. "QUEEN ELIZABETH"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every Sunday, to drive for 55 hours? In exasperation, "Erin" gestures with both hands - taking off the wheel. Nothing bad happens, but again her reckles makes us nervous - "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not 55 - "QUEEN ELIZABETH"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just to reach some phone booth?! Hey can I call Daddy this time?! Please??? Please please please... "Erin" shakes her head. "Queen E." gives her a mournful look. "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't beg. You look like a dog. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Erin" is on the phone, "Queen E." at her side. "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Tyler? It's Slim.     59

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TYLER'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Oh thank God. Listen. Mitch is planning some legal action, you're depriving him of his rights as a father, some nonsense like that: you better have Gracie call him. "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh that's good news -

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TYLER'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I thought you'd want to know - "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do, thanks, I appreciate it. Listen: we have to keep it short again or he might trace it, so I better put her on - (hands phone to:) "QUEEN ELIZABETH"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Grandma! I have a new name! (as "Erin" frowns...) Yeah! You wanna hear it? "Erin" pushes down the lever, ending the call, mutters: "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, your Majesty. Remember: names're secret. "Queen E." nods. Puts on her mournful look... "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is the most pitiful expression I've ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: "QUEEN ELIZABETH"
dialogues.text: She listens, cradling the phone. "Erin" watches her daugh face light up: "QUEEN ELIZABETH"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Daddy! We're having a great vacation! (PAUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. At a phone booth somewheres. "Erin" shakes her head, takes the receiver away:     60 "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No questions, okay?, or it ends now. (hands phone back to "Queen E.":) Just tell him you love him and say goodbye, okay? "Queen E." nods, puts the receiver to her ear. Even "Erin hear Mitch yelling... "Queen E."'s face changes. Mitch ke shouting angrily. "QUEEN ELIZABETH"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye Daddy. She did not say "I love you." She hands "Erin" the receiv "Erin" hangs it up. "QUEEN ELIZABETH"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am really really sad. "Erin" nods, angry at herself: "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, kid. My mistake. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch hands up his cordless phone, picks up another line. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know mine was (too) short, but she made other calls, right? Ginny?, or my mother? He crosses to a map with colored pins. Sticks in another

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Good. Good. Keep it up. (hangs up, goes to intercom:) Isn't he here yet? Great, yeah, send him in. To our shock, the person who enters is the man previously as "Our Hero." ROBBIE (real name) and Mitch are good budd MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. ROBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.     61 MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, will you tell what's his face, Lieutenant Harris: I bought his Miata, I paid for his rec room, can he please keep his patrolmen from hassling my guys? ROBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got me on a Sunday, for that? (JOKE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could be out shaking down wetbacks. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't bring you for that. ROBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her? (off Mitch' s nod) I told you not to be an asshole. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but coming from you... ROBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had rules, okay? The rescue routine - like in the diner? It always worked, 'cause we said: one time only. You come, then you go. But you end up marrying the bitchl MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where she is, Robbie. More or less. ROBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a blessing. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to find her. Take your VACATION -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
