dialogues.text: (as Robbie rolls his eyes) I'll make it worth your while, and I'll fix it with the department - ROBBIE (DRILY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Thanks a lot. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else'm I gonna get? Huh? She stole my fucking childl     62 C ; ROBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. Ease it up. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walks to map, pins) She made calls from these places - ROBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's that stupid? You traced her? MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not stupid, okay? It says on the Net it takes 84 seconds to trace a call; she keeps hers well under. (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course-your equipment is faster. ROBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome, you're welcome... MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drawing on map) Okay: say she lives within a two hour radius... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Erin" and "Queen E." eating pasta. The sauce is unusual colors, grey and orange. "Queen E." pokes politely at her plate. "Erin" is understandably insecure about her cookin "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think, is it okay? It's okay, right? "Queen E." nods dubiously.

dialogues.speaker: "ERIN", (CONT.)
dialogues.text: No, it's not, it's horrible. "QUEEN ELIZABETH"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not horrible, Mom. "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's not good, is it? Is it good? "QUEEN ELIZABETH" (INCREDULOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Good??) Mom, you tasted it.     63

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Erin" pushes her plate back. It's too much. in a second, silent tears are flooding down her face. This is not what "Queen E." wants to see. And she certain doesn't want to reverse roles by giving comfort. Better j to pretend it's not happening. "QUEEN ELIZABETH"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what I think? "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tries to pull HERSELF TOGETHER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? "QUEEN ELIZABETH"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you miss Daddy. This comment is so wacko that it's almost touching. Almos She feels compelled to be honest: "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy yells at me, Toots. "Queen E." nods. Thinks... "QUEEN ELIZABETH"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. You miss somebody. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe gets off a plane with his carry-on luggage, goes to a of pay phones, examines the numbers on the phones... ANOTHER BANK OF PAY PHONES. MINUTES LATER. When one of these phones rings, he picks it up - JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, my plane was delayed - EXT. ROADSIDE STAND. PAY PHONE. DAY. "Queen E." is hitting stones with a baseball bat as "Erin talks on the phone:     64 "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rent a car, make sure you're not followed, drive to the Taos airport. JOE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another plane?? "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Taos, go to Starbucks. Not the main one or the one by Hagen-Dazs. The one near the book store. INT. SANTA FE AIRPORT. DAY. Joe shakes his head, amused: JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this, a treasure hunt? I'm gonna spend the whole weekend flying around? "ERIN'S" VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call Starbucks in three hours. (REASSURING HIM:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, you'll be here by four. Dialtone. He hangs up. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Erin" and "Queen E." look out the window at a small prop plane, which is starting to unload passengers. "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you it's this one. "QUEEN ELIZABETH"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he's not. He's with... She's looking at some OTHER PASSENGERS who have already e through another gate and are walking past them. "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Toots. That one's from Reno. (turns back, sees him) There! Joel She waves. "Queen E." waves too. Joe waves back.     65

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's not what we're looking at. We're. looking at R walking slowly toward them with the other Reno passengers He doesn't see "Erin", but in a moment he will. He'll tur dogleg corner and be right next to them... Robbie pulls out his boarding pass. With it are old photo "Erin" and "Queen E.11. He shuffles past the photos, find claim check. He's now only a few feet away from them... And they're oblivious of him... And he turns the little dogleg and looks at them - Except they're no longer there. They've moved toward the unloading area for Joe's gate... And Robbie goes safely past as Joe enters the terminal, s them, shakes his head: JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can guarantee one thing in my lifetime: I was not followed. He embraces "Erin" and "Queen E."" The CAMERA looks past to where Robbie might be watching. He's not. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. THEIR TAURUS/MAIN STREET, SMALL TOWN. DAY.
dialogues.text: "Erin" and "Queen E." are pointing out sights, passing an FASHIONED DINER: "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's the diner where I do not work. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you work? "Erin" gives him a look: she's not telling. She resumes t tour, points to an old crumbling "movie palace:"' "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's the one-plex. (pointing again at a NOT-TOO-FANCY PLACE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The an restaurant where you'd take me if we were dating... (for "Queen E.19 which we are not.     66

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very fast, like an old routine; we see how they play toge JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just friends, right Gracie? "QUEEN ELIZABETH"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen Elizabeth. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Sorry, your highness. "QUEEN ELIZABETH"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. "Erin" pulls up in front of their house, gestures: here i INT. "ERIN'S" HOUSE. HALL. DAY. Continuing the tour, they're showing him: "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is the guest bedroom... (CONT . )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes in, looks around. Clearly "Queen E." has painted walls herself : it's a "modern-art" mesa.

dialogues.speaker: "ERIN", (CONT.)
dialogues.text: .normally known as Buckingham palace. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, checks it out) Very... colorful. "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better warn him, huh? "Queen E." looks confused. "Erin" whispers in her daughte ear, and she confides in Joe:     67 "QUEEN ELIZABETH"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. The dreams in here get really noisy. Joe sets his suitcase down. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I look forward to that. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baseball diamond. Joe pitching underhand to "Queen E." He using plastic balls the size of soccer balls, so it's eas her to hit every one. "Erin" is running, retrieving the hits. FREEZE FRAME as she's caught in a photograph. The image unfreezes and is followed quickly by a series o frozen frames, photographs of her, some wide, some tight. REVERSE IMAGE. The park. Mostly empty. No one taking their picture. A st of green bushes. HOLD on the bushes for a moment - EXT. PARK. AN HOUR LATER. "Queen E." is curled on a blanket taking a nap as "Erin" Joe finish the picnic. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem like you're doing great. "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long can you stand it? (off her look) I mean: not to talk to your friends or family or have anything to do with your real life?     68 "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet, strong) Gracie is safe. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but what, now Mitch started some kind of custody battle?, what DOES - ROBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Denise? SHOCK. There he is, standing right over them, in bad clot and a baseball cap, dark glasses. Completely unrecognizab "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me? ROBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Denise, right? Used to work at the Pack 'N' Ship? "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not Denise. ROBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Sorry, I... You look-but you're right, your voice... (isn't) You're not from New Zealand, are you? "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never been there. ROBBIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy. Sorry to bother you folks. He backs away, embarrassed. Joe stares after him warily.. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now? We call Pack 'N' Ship, see if Denise ever - (worked there) "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because of some homeless guy? Joe: it could be the Pack'N'Ship in Trenton, New Jersey. (over his protest) One thing I learned: I can't jump every time someone says boo. I can't do that to her.     69

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe looks at "Queen E." and nods. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks peaceful. But why do we need this establishing shot Its very existence in the narrative is menacing. INT. "ERIN'S" HOUSE. NIGHT. Joe gets up from "Queen E. 's" bed and goes into the kitc Gets some juice from the fridge, drinks it. Looks into "Erin's" bedroom. "Erin" is awake, "Queen E." asleep at her side. Half -whi JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gracie was right. (off her look) 'Bout the dreams in there. "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, mine too. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuddle? INT. "ERIN'S" BEDROOM. NIGHT. As he gets into bed: "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember the house rules? JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Gracie here? Who can forget? They hold hands. "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever think about what would've happened...(if you and I had...)     70 JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? Beat. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Gracie is truly a great kid, and any path that doesn't include her doesn't make any sense. "Erin" nods. Beat. "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginny told me about that weekend. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of your wedding? She nods. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tell you how terrible I was? "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe. This routine? It might work on other people, but you forget: I've actually had you - JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't forget - "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like a compliment's coming) - and I'm telling you, from memory... (DRY TEASE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: you are not that bad... They both laugh. It subsides into affection... "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really go tomorrow...? He nods.

dialogues.speaker: "ERIN", (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Couldn't you quit your job, and stay here and play the horses or something and become independently wealthy?     71

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please kiss me, Slim. I know we're not supposed to, it's against house rules and all, but for me to come all this way and feel the way I do and for us to not even - She kisses him - And he kisses back. And they stop. Incredible self control. Lie next to each other-hold hands again... JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a great person, Slim. You're a great person just like your daughter. She squeezes his hand. THE CAMERA LINGERS FOR A MOMENT ON THIS SWEET IMAGE... cl hands...THEN PULLS SUDDENLY BACK, so we're seeing their h from outside, through a crack in the window. Hold. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU CAN RUNs s s EXT. PRESCHOOL. DAY. From an odd distance across the street, we watch "Erin" dropping off "Queen E." Extend the mundane details of thi transaction... THREE DAYS LATER INT. DOUBLE "A" RENT-A-CAR. DAY. T.T. sticks her head in, to "Erin": T.T. I know you have a "back room" gig, but with Sher out, four customers: I need help here; I'm on meltdown.     72

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We look. past a tree, through the windows...as "Erin" com warily out to the counter, looks over the customers... INT. DOUBLE A RENT-A-CAR. COUNTER. LATER. DAY. "Erin" working a calculator, muttering in frustration... T.T. Here, lemme do that. As T.T. wrestles with the calculation, "Erin" looks up. F slightly, her eyes shift... She senses something. This strange sensation, as if she's being watched, or... She looks out the window, doesn't see anyone... Glances into the back office - and notices the clock: 4:1 "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (runs for door) Oh my Godl, the Queen is out of dance class! I'll be back in 20 - EXT. DOUBLE "A" RENT-A-CAR. DAY. We watch from across the street as "Erin" hurries to her Taurus, gets in and drives away. EXT. PRE-SCHOOL. DAY. "Erin" in line for Pick-up. Betty the Pre-school Director comes up to "Erin" and says casually: BETTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erin. I'm glad you're here. We can't find Queen Elizabeth - "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't find her                         BETTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So many kids're staying for these after-school things - She turns, distracted, as ANOTHER TEACHER calls -     73

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: n "Erin" blinks... looks around frantically... OTHER KIDS dance gear, but no "Queen E."...and the knowledge of what happened is hitting her...her eyes're dilating, breathing becoming frantic. Betty turns back as "Erin" mutters: "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should've! ... I should've known!, he did it before! She rams the car in gear, rockets out of the pick-up line Almost hits a TEACHER and 4 YEAR OLD KID - Slams the breaks, calls: "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I... I... Freaked out, frantic, she pulls to the side of the road, up her brake, grabs her cell phone. Auto-dial #2.

dialogues.speaker: T.T.'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Double "A" Rent "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Queen Elizabeth call?!

dialogues.speaker: T.T.'S VOICE
dialogues.text: No, of course - (not) "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone else?!

dialogues.speaker: T.T.'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Nobody called, Erin; are you - (okay?) "Erin" presses STOP, then Auto-dial #1, waits, looks arou Betty staring at her like she's crazy, walking toward her "ERIN'S" VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Leave a message. "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gracie, are you there?! Is anyone there?! Please? Pick up! No one picks up. Silence. She beats the wheel in frustration... lowers her head. For one long second, she seems completely beaten...     74

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KNOCK on her window - She looks up, sees Betty. Betty's talking, but it's as if "Erin" has gone crazy. Fo moment there's no sound, and then the sound is there but unintelligible, and finally the words and sounds come tog BETTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .what I've been trying to tell you... "Erin" nodding now, beginning to grasp the words...

dialogues.speaker: BETTY, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: At the end of dance class, the teacher lets them go hide, and for a minute no one could find her - "Erin" looks past Betty, sees "Queen E." in her tutu and out of her car - "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, thank you, I... I'm sorry. I'll explain later, I... She rushes forward, wraps "Queen E." in a big, not quite appropriate hug. "Queen E." looks at her as if to say, "T is nice, Mom, but will you please tell me what gives?" CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a distance, we watch "Erin" and "Queen E." trudge to their Taurus. The end of the day; they're tired. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Making meat loaf. "Erin" consults the cookbook, seems confused, puts meat, breadcrusts, eggs, sauces, onions, e a bowl. "Queen E." mooshes them with her fingers - a disgusting tactile job which she adores. IMPROVISE DIALOG make the scene utterly mundane, two "girls" having fun... normalness of it makes us exceedingly nervous. INT. "ERIN'S" HOUSE. NIGHT. "Queen E." sleeping peacefully in her bed.     75

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Erin" also sleeping peacefully. We OBSERVE her from a sl distance, to the left of the bed as we face it. Slowly th CAMERA BEGINS TO MOVE. . .down the bed...to the foot ...t other side.. .back again on "Erin" sleeping peacefully... the CAMERA RISES to show Mitch seated at her side. He seems calm and utterly content. It would be, hard to i a more terrifying attitude. INT. HER BEDROOM. DAWN. "Erin" wakes with a start, sits up, looks around - Everything's normal. Peaceful. No Mitch. "Erin" shakes her head, as if clearing away a dream. As she looks again around the room, her nostrils flare slightly. . .as if she smells him. She rubs her nose. Touches her wrist, and we notice something she's worn the time she's been Erin: a colorful elastic bracelet, probab Swatch. She gets out of bed and looks out the window - Cold morning - She goes toward the hall... INT. HALL. DAY. Moving down the hall... each open door feels like a trap to spring... She glances into "Queen Elizabeth's" room... We half expe some sort of reaction or exclamation - "Queen E." may be but instead "Erin" keeps right on going... Vanishes into the bathroom. HOLD the empty hall. HEAR the sound of her peeing... INT. BATHROOM. DAY. From the doorway, we see her on the potty... The window o her head is open slightly.     76

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she pees, she stares at the shower curtain-it rustles slightly in the wind from the window. She wipes herself. Still staring at the curtain... She stands, pulls up her pajamas... Stares. Yanks the shower curtain aside - Nothing. INT. HALL. DAY. She goes into the kitchen. INT. KITCHEN. DAY. She puts on the kettle. Drinks a little o.3 from a carton. Walks back down the hall - In every moment of this, the tension is excruciating... INT. HALL. DAY. Facing her as she comes down the hall, passing the living doorway.. .we wait for Mitch to leap out at her - He doesn't. She keeps coming, past "Queen E's -

dialogues.speaker: HE JUMPS OUT OF THE DOORWAY -
dialogues.text: " Erin" starts to scream, looks toward "Queen E." and sti the sound. They wrestle. Silently. Grim pantomime. The only sounds a GRUNTS, BANGING vs. the walls. He's far too strong for her - They slam against one wall, the other, CRASH to the floor     77 MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna know a secret? Whispering to her, his hands moving to her neck...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Cops need a body. Without your body, they'll think you disappeared again. Her hands at his hands, clawing, trying to pry them loose

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Which is kind of true. One of her hands moves-away from his hands to that Swatch whatever it is on her wrist -

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: 'Cause where you're going, they will never... ever... find you. She turns the gizmo so it points away from her face... Toward his face... At the last instant he realizes what she must be doing - But it's too late. She presses a button - Orange spray hits his face, eyes - He screams and releases her - She leaps up - and Sees "Queen E." standing in her doorwa Staring, mute and horrified. How long was she watching?! "Erin" grabs "Queen E." and runs down the hall. Mitch wri on the floor - EXT. "ERIN'S" HOUSE. DAWN. "Erin" bursts out the back door, whirls, pulls a rope - - Causing a slab of 2-by-4 to slide over the door: primit locking device - She sprints for her Taurus. Still in her pajamas, still carrying "Queen E." - Her car has a number pad on the driver's door. She punche numbers, opens the door, puts "Queen E." in -     78

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulls a key from under the mat - Fires the car up, rockets away - Down the block, so far back we're not even sure it means anything, a CHEVY SUBURBAN pulls away from the curb... EXT./INT. MALL/TAURUS DAWN. Parked in back, near dumpsters. "Erin" jumps out of the Taurus, runs around to the trunk, pulls out a small suitc MOMENTS LATER. "Erin" and "Queen E." pulling clothes from the suitcase, getting dressed. A FRANTIC BLUR of pajamas and underwear suitcase and the last thing we expect to see: KNOCK at the window. Robbie. "Erin" whirls, looks. For an instant TIME SLOWS as she stares at him... FLASHBACK TO THE DINER, HIS FACE: she recognizes him - And realizes: he's with Mitch. Which means: Mitch was pho from the moment she met him - Robbie reaches for her door handle - She rams the accelerator, leaving Robbie behind - The car rockets forward, toward the dumpsters - She spins the wheel; the car swerves, kisses off the dump Robbie running for his car, and now we see the Chevy Subu hidden behind some nearby bushes - The Taurus pogos over the concrete/grass divider, rockets across the next parking lot... Robbie jumping into his Suburban - "Erin" half in, half out of her clothing, trying to drive trying to see, sticking out her arm to keep "Queen E." (n her seatbelt) from flying through the windshield. "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seatbelti Seatbelti Put on your -     79 "QUEEN ELIZABETH"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to put it on) Then slow down so I - "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't slow'- "QUEEN ELIZABETH"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that guy?! "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks in rear-view) I don't know, some... (sees Robbie chasing them) Oh shit... EXT. CITY. MORNING. Three brief FLASHES of -"Erin" being chased out of the ci Freaked out to drive so fast, "Queen E." screaming, etc. EXT. COUNTRY ROAD. MORNING. Robbie's Suburban right behind them, closer, closer... fi slams into their Taurus, knocking them half off the road. pushes them off again, again, "Queen E." covering her eye "Erin" coming back onto the road, fighting to keep contro the road narrowing more and more, down to one tight lane. looks like totally the wrong place to be leading someone. "QUEEN ELIZABETH" (WORRIED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom? Up ahead is a one-lane covered bridge crossing over a str The bridge is very narrow. "QUEEN ELIZABETH"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, are you sure...?! Quite sure, thank you. "Erin" guns the accelerator. Robbie's FACE... driving, confident, full of blood lust, then his expression changes. Eyes widen. He realizes - sh too late!! - that the bridge is way too narrow for - "Erin" Is car slides through, scraping one side The Suburban crashes into the bridge, careens into the wa     80

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Queen E." looks back through the rear view mirror... loo her mother ...back and forth... "QUEEN ELIZABETH"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CAR. MORNING
dialogues.text: Different country road. Parked ahead is a `78 Oldsmobile. "Erin" pulls in behind it. They get out of the Taurus. Using her keys, "Erin" unlock trunk of the Olds. Two large suitcases inside. "Erin" thr their small suitcase in on top. "Erin" reaches up under the driver's seat and pulls out a wallet. Checks the contents: cash, credit cards. "Queen E." pulls a red wig out of the glove compartment. INT. OLDSMOBILE. MORNING. They're on a lightly travelled two-lane highway. "Erin" ( redhead) looks in her rear-view mirror: no cars. "ERIN"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Toots. We can talk. "Queen E." stares at her mutely.

dialogues.speaker: "ERIN"
dialogues.text: Want me to tell you what happened? "Queen E." blinks twice, shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: "ERIN"
dialogues.text: Fair enough. One thing, though: Erin's over. "QUEEN ELIZABETH"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Too bad.} I liked Erin. Slim nods sadly: she liked Erin too. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not the Queen of England anymore either. Gracie nods fatalistically, stares out the window. Flat v     81 GRACIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hungry. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gracie eating voraciously. Slim has no appetite. Their WAITRESS comes over, notices Slim's not eating - WAITRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything okay here? SLIM (NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. WAITRESS (TO GRACIE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there, cutie, what's your name? Gracie looks up at her for a while. GRACIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working on that one. The waitress does a double-take and leaves. To Slim:

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE
dialogues.text: Maybe something normal this time. Ann or Mary or... (sees Slim is distracted) Mom? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking. Beat. GRACIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Yeah,) I can hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim parks. As she starts to get out, she says to Gracie: SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody talks to you, hit the horn.     82

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim in line at a COUNTY RECORDER'S desk. The person in f of her leaves, she steps up: SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need the best lawyer in town. (QUICKLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you can't give names, it's against the law or whatever, but I really need help, and I can see you're a decent person. She slides a paper and pencil across the desk:

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Please. Just a name. INT. NICE LAWYER'S OFFICE. RECEPTION AREA. DAY. Slim comes in, sits Gracie down and whispers: SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch how it's done. 117 Slim goes to the Receptionist's desk: SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Is Mr. Toiler with someone? RECEPTIONIST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but he's - SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a crazy person. She walks past the Receptionist - RECEPTIONIST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute! You can't Slim opens the big door, enters: INT. JIM TOLLER'S OFFICE. DAY. The moment we see JIM TOILER we know Slim's okay. The act playing him is one of those cranky avuncular types who pi and moans but always comes to the rescue and outsmarts th guys. As we expect, he starts out disliking her:     83 JIM TOLLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where you learned manners, young lady, but this is not the way to get my attention. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but I'm desperate. (digging into purse) My husband keeps trying to kill me, and I need to talk to somebody who's smart, okay?, smarter than me at least. (pulling out cash) This is all the money I have - well, all but twenty - it's almost 500, and I'll give you all of it if you'll just listen to what... (happened)... just two minutes, okay? Please? She's so charming and intense and discombobulated, he can help but give in. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: LATER.
dialogues.text: He's staring at her. Good poker player; we can tell nothi from his expression. His voice very quiet and calm: JIM TOLLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon my French, dear, but I hope you got pleasure from it, 'cause you have really fucked yourself. You had two chances to file a complaint with the police and put his violence on record. You ignored them. Which tells him to keep comin' till he kills you. Slim reacts to this.

dialogues.speaker: JIM TOLLER, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: As for Gracie: his next move... he'll initiate a custody hearing. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He...he already did.     84 JIM TOLLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't show up, the judge'll rule against you, you become a fugitive from the law. If you do show, Mitch will, as you say, portray you as a drug addict. For all I know you are one: you break in here, uninvited. I'd say your husband has a good chance for sole custody. Now if you don't mind: (pushes the money back at her) I'd like to go back to my work. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stares at him in disbelief) .That's all? (off his silence) You're not gonna help me? JIM TOLLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one can help you, lady. She nods. Stares at him. And does not go. After a moment see him have a thought... hesitate... look up at her... JIM TOLLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The custody hearing, if he pushes for it, is just a trick. She says nothing. Listens. Watches as: He plucks a $20 bill from her stack of funds. Obviously h giving her a valuable piece of advice:

dialogues.speaker: JIM TOLLER, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: It's a way to get you to a particular place at a particular time... so he can kill you. He pockets the $20. She stares at him. Blinks. Of course. He's right...- CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late. Few cars. Slim drives. Gracie curled up in the fron passenger seat. Slim glances at her. Looks back at the ro Back at Gracie. Something building. Finally, softly:     85 SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta make you a solemn promise, Grace. Gracie is, of course, fast asleep.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Ever since you were born ... well-one day I started to think of all the awful things that were gonna happen. People you'd love who'd die, or leave you, betray you, break your heart... .Physical injuries: broken bones or sickness or guys who hurt you some way... And I thought that if I could protect you even once, from any of those, if I could absorb any part of that myself... (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... Here goes. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginny comes off a plane with her two kids. in tow, looks heads for a bank of telephones... As she approaches, one the phones starts to ring. Ginny looks at it with irritation, picks it up - GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the most ridiculous thing I've ever done. SLIM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? How 'bout Horace? Ginny glances at one of her kids, evidently Horace's chil GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, this is the second most - SLIM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rent a car, drive to Denver, then fly to Reno. GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're out of your mind. I     86 SLIM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as though flattered) You noticed. Dialtone. We watch from a distance as Ginny shakes her head in disb mutters to her kids. As they trudge off, the CAMERA FOLLO INT. AIRPORT. RENTAL CAR COUNTER. DAY. From the same distance: Ginny and kids approach the count INT. AIRPORT PARKING GARAGE. RENT-A-CAR AREA. DAY. Ginny loading luggage into the back as her kids climb in. As Ginny slams the trunk, SOMEONE'S RIGHT THERE - Slim. Ginny blinks, recognizes her, hugs her: GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you... (doing here?) I thought we were... (driving to Reno) SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to make sure you weren't followed. GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re Slim's hair) I like it. (not so sure) Maybe. (SEES GRACIE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Graceland. Gracie slips out from behind Slim, goes and hugs Ginny as holds up a wallet: SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a credit card and cash. It's on me, but make no calls home, or to Phil. Think of it as a vacation till the Orca reopens. Toots?     87

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This to Gracie, who started to climb into the car. Gracie looks at Slim and again tries to climb in - she wants }}g of saying goodbye - but Slim pulls her back into a hug. Slim holds her for as long as Gracie can possibly tolerat When Slim is done, Gracie climbs into the car with Ginny' kids. Slim has tears in her eyes. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care of her, okay? Extra ice- cream and... and if you need to reach me... (hands her a cell phone) Just don't call your friends. GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh great. I'll call strangers. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In an emergency, I'm #1 on the auto- dialer. Or I'll call you. Any calls between us must run is seconds or less. Cake? GINNY PIE - SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ass. (re the vacation) Enjoy it, huh? GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The custody hearing's end of next month. That's my deadline. GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deadline for what? Slim looks at her... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: SLOWLY PULLS BACK
dialogues.text: Intense, focussed.     88 THE KNOWLEDGE MAN'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready? She nods. CAMERA CONTINUES BACK, we see more of her face. MAN'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure? Another nod. Perspiration streaming from her pores, runni down her face. And a look we haven't seen before. MAN'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you lose? She shakes her head. MAN'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can he hurt you? She barely dignifies the question with another shake. We' now far enough back to see we are: INT. GYM. DAY. Slim in a leotard. MAN'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even though he's bigger? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (v. quiet) He's a lot bigger. MAN'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even though he's stronger? Finally see her INSTRUCTOR (6'4", 235 pounds, African-Ame 0.4% body fat). SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a lot stronger. INSTRUCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if he hits you - SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.     89 INSTRUCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes.twice as much energy to swing and miss as to swing and hit. INSTRUCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After he misses, what do you do? She answers him with an intense look. He nods and moves after her. Slow, strong, powerful: pred She backs up. Her movements simple, graceful, economical athletic: they remind us of the easy way she moved around restaurant in the first scene... Scattered over the mat are old-fashioned plastic SANTAS t kids use as punching bags. He backs her toward one... .then another. As she nears them, she slides deftly to th side: like she has eyes in the back of her head... He maneuvers her toward a desk-her back to it... Rushes at her - For a moment she seems trapped - But as he reaches her, she slips to her left, tosses him the desk and onto the mat. She moves quickly to an attacking position, standing over He pats the mat beside him. She sits. He makes a motion and she closes her eyes. INSTRUCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One last thing. The hardest lesson: we can't control the universe. She listens.

dialogues.speaker: INSTRUCTOR, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: The unexpected may happen. He slides his hand over the mat, an order. She lies down. 01     90

dialogues.speaker: INSTRUCTOR, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Suddenly his maid enters, you're distracted for an instant, and he hits you... SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not possible - INSTRUCTOR 4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must prepare even for the impossible. She stirs slightly, uncomfortable with this idea.

dialogues.speaker: INSTRUCTOR, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: We bend the universe to our will, but it will only go so far. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're saying - INSTRUCTOR (STANDING UP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right -

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: For the sake of this exercise, he hits me. He's standing over her. She looks completely vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: VERY TIGHT ON HER AS
dialogues.text: INSTRUCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. And you lie there as if dead. But hear me. Hold onto my voice. She nods almost imperceptibly.

dialogues.speaker: INSTRUCTOR, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: He's standing over you, he thinks he's won-and as sure as he's a coward, he'll try to kick you. SLIM (SOFTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.     91 INSTRUCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And because you know what he'll do, you're smiling inside,... (CONT.) Her face blank, eyes still closed-but something changes; sense her confidence and serenity returning. He draws his foot back as if to kick her... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. JUPITER'S OFFICE. (San Francisco) DAY. Slim strides through the office unapologetically interrup various conversations. Finally she spots Jupiter, walks o and without saying a word, demands his attention - JUPITER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the others) Ah. Just a sec, I'll be right back. (to her, irritated} I thought I made it clear you weren't supposed to come here. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what you want. This almost makes him smile; he's getting to like her. JUPITER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a different person. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? JUPITER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that black guy I .set you up with? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. JUPITER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he teach you how to think? It's not the question she expected; it's more interesting complicated.     92 SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .I hope so. (before he can speak) The English guy is good too. (ALL BUSINESS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's not why I'm here. I need a woman who looks like me. Someone who can handle herself: an off-duty cop or something. (hands him photo) Five four, one ten. Hair like this but cut higher, over the ear - (hands him key) Miko hotel, room 509, 8 o'clock. JUPITER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonic ? That's awful short notice; I don't know if I can - SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I thought Jupiter was like all-powerful, king of the Gods? Oh yeah. One more thing. At some point.. .not right now 'cause it'd be phony ...I need you to acknowledge that I'm your kid. She walks away. He stares after her. Hint of a smile come his face. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim is signing the credit card slip as the CLERK puts th merchandise in a distinctive red bag - SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure this'll work? CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet your life. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, I will. She leaves, taking out her cell phone. FOLLOW HER as she EXT. SAN FRANCISCO STREET. DAY. She walks up the street, punches in a number...     93 BUTLER'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler residence. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Tony. Could you please tell Mrs. Tyler that I'll call her around f our this afternoon. BUTLER'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, Miss Slim. My pleasure. Slim hangs up, goes into a. bagel shop. INT.. BAGEL PLACE. LATER. Slim sits at a table with a cup of coffee. A short guy, 2 built like a fireplug, dressed in sweater and jeans and w cap, enters, walks to her, and says in an English accent: ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today, hon, you graduate. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Slim are across the street from a strip joint. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's closed? ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Till six, eh? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'd guess whoever owns it isn't a very nice person. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a safe one. Slim starts walking toward the shop. As they go: SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why here? ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got soft hands, you've worked hard. The tricky part now is nerves. They reach the entryway; Slim takes out her tools.     94 SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People on the street? ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. And you have to go in when his alarm's turned off - SLIM (NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning he's inside. (has tools out) I'm ready. Alex moves slightly to block the view as Slim bends over slips her tool into the lock... Slim working quietly, concentrating... Alex looking. around... A SHADY CHARACTER noticing them. Hesitating. Coming over. ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got company, doll... Slim still working... The Shady Character has almost reached them... ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. You're too slow. She opens the door - Alex glances down, nods - She closes the door again and stands just as: SHADY CHARACTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. What're you guys up to? Slim stares at him. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were hoping to see some action, but it looks like they're closed. The Shady Character stares back. He is ve skeptical. He watches Slim and Alex walk off down the block. Alex mu under his breath:     95 ALEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Action?" Off her grin - CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim sits in a chair, cell phone at her ear. Her hair is now she's getting a manicure.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TYLER'S VOICE
dialogues.text: And where is Gracie? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's coming day after tomorrow, then we're flying to L.A. I was thinking after the hearing, maybe I could bring her by.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. TYLER'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Tell me something. Why is this call different? You were always worried about how long we talked - SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was out in the country, Mrs. T. I'm in a big city now, meeting with my lawyer, so there're lots of cell phones. No one can trace this. EXT. BEAUTY PARLOR. DAY. Slim exits in a long gray coat. Stops outside for one moment, glances around - Sees a guy in a GREEN TRENCHCOAT across the street. She walks hurriedly away. Glances over her shoulder, sees Trenchcoat following her. She smiles slightly, to herself. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a discreet distance, across the street, we watch her into her hotel.     96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trenchcoat is standing across the street. INT. HOTEL ROOM. DAY. Slim enters her suite. Sitting by the window is TOVA. As Slim walks over, Tova p on a wig which matches Slim's haircut. There is now a str resemblance. TOVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Tova Steinberg. Slim stares. Tova's voice is an octave lower than Slim's. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say something else. TOVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was a cop. I got shot, took the benefits. Slim thinks about Tova's voice. Takes out her cell phone. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have to think I'm still here, so use my cell phone, tomorrow, to call my dad. Autodial 2. Slim presses the autodial number, then SEND, and motions Tova to put on Slim's gray coat. It fits Tova perfectly.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: (lowering his voice) Hey, it's me. JUPITER'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your voice?; you okay? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I'm getting some bronchial thing. JUPITER'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otherwise everything's okay? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.     97 JUPITER'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get some rest, huh? She presses END, says to Tova, back to normal voice: SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow stay in, order room service. Call him twice. Keep it brief. "Hello, I don't feel well..." TOVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And tonight? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go around the corner, eat at Guido's. TOVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be followed? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Green trenchcoat. Tova nods and Slim takes off her own wig. Short dark hair

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Wish me luck, huh? TOVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luck has nothing to do with it. Tova smiles. INT. HOTEL. HALL. NIGHT. Slim waiting as the Service Elevator arrives. Gets in. EXT. HOTEL. REAR ENTRANCE. NIGHT. Slim going out the door, down the alley...     98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim getting on the plane to Los Angeles. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim parks, looks across at a warehouse converted into lo

dialogues.speaker: BATTLE OF THE
dialogues.text: She takes a duffle from the back seat. Steps into the sha stares at the warehouse: Brick building, modern door and light fixtures. SEXES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks both ways: The street's dark. Deserted. She hoists her duffle, takes a deep breath. And crosses the street. Goes up the stairs to the stoop. Looks at the alarm panel the door: green. Crouches, starts to work on the lock. INT. WAREHOUSE/LOFT. SLEEPING AREA. NIGHT. Mitch in bed, sleeping. Peaceful. A SOUND, Off. He stirs slightly. ANOTHER SOUND. He sits up. Frowning... dazed. Cocks his head. Listens... The SILENCE seems to have texture. He gets up.     99

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We glimpse: a beautiful brick warehouse converted inside an open, loft-like space filled with bird'seye maple, met beams, etc. Modern, glistening, expensive. He walks around the place in the dark. In his boxer shorts and t-shirt. He looks vulnerable... SLIM'S POV... From one corner. Observing him. She has bec the stalker. HER EYES, watching... He decides everything's okay and goes back to the semi partitioned sleeping area... He gets back into bed - next to a YOUNG BLOND WOMAN, 22. She turns over, mutters something, goes back to sleep. He lies there, eyes open. Stays very still. Listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bright light. Mitch in his bathrobe making coffee. The Yo Blond Woman comes out, fully dressed... MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee? YOUNG BLOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get home, change for work. He nods, gives her a perfunctory kiss: MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you. She stares at him a second. YOUNG BLOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want my number? MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. She sees how "eager" he is to talk to her again. Irritate she scribbles the number quickly, hands.it to him - MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for everything.     100

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the sex, in other words. She gives it right back to h YOUNG BLOND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too. I really appreciate it. He's too self-centered to notice her ironic tone. She lets herself out. The instant she does, we go to a HIGH ANGLE looking down Mitch. Alternate NORMAL and HIGH ANGLE during: Mitch pours coffee, goes back into his "dressing area" an pulls on some clothes as he talks into his cell phone: MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janie? Hey. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was working late. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, tonight's no good either. I've got a morning flight to San Francisco. Slim in therafters, listening.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: If it was pleasure, you'd be going too. No, I'm going down to get my daughter. Slim's reaction to this...

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Sure, the custody hearing's here next week, but it looks like Gracie's being brought to San Francisco and my ex-wife ...well, seems like she completely vanished. ON SLIM. His words echo his threats when he was trying to strangle her in her hallway.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Right off the face of the earth. I doubt they'll ever find her this time. Slim's jaw tightens. When we come back to Mitch, he's dressed and packing his briefcase.     101

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, I want her to meet you. We'll call when we get in. (FAKE TENDER:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too. He hangs up, takes a sip of coffee. HIGH ANGLE SHOT looking down on Mitch as he heads out the Slim waits in the rafters until the alarm system beeps: i armed. She climbs down, walks into the kitchen. Notices his Mr. Coffee machine is still on. Hesitates, turns it off. Opens the fridge to find something to eat - The alarm beeps again. Slim drops silently to the floor. SOUND of the KEY IN THE LOCK - Slim scuttles away as we hear: FRONT DOOR OPENING. FOOTSTEPS coming toward her. She slips around the edge of the counter just as: Mitch enters the kitchen. He goes to the Mr. Coffee... Lo at it... Frowns. Didn't he leave it on...? Slim in the foreground, crouched down, Mitch 15 feet away looks around. Is something wrong? Is someone here? Slim frozen, trying not to breath. Mitch listening. Wondering: should he search the place? She looks for a place to hide - He looks at his watch. He's late. He walks right toward Slim, curls around the counter - But she's not there any longer. He heads for the front door -     102

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goes out. HOLD ON the hall, where she was, where he walke EMPTY. The alarm beeps again as he resets it. One silent beat, then Slim rises in the kitchen. (She did
She sighs. Pours herself some coffee, replaces the liquid water. Auto-dials her cell phone. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in. GINNY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you stay off the phone? GINNY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you, honey? (Anything.) SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so. She hangs up. Retrieves her duffle bag from its hiding place and pulls tools, equipment, etc. Picks up a screwdriver and starts searching the apartment, checking the phone line, followi to the place where it enters the apartment. MONTAGE INTERCUT WITH FLASHES of Slim' a face: a running on her emotions. Intensity, focus, determination, fear,. as the sequence builds: concern about what she doing... MONTAGE IMAGES :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She disconnects the phone line. Finds the electrical box, opens it, finds the main switch Removes all the knives from the kitchen... hides them... Walks the apartment-familiarizing herself with every inch it-occasionally she moves a piece of furniture slightly.. realize: she's assessing fighting spaces. angles... She looks from one piece of furniture to another, back an forth, gauging the distance between them. She eats a snack from his refrigerator...     103 I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks out the back (bedroom) window... and sees the water J

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: San Pedro harbor below her. Uses a metal detector to search the apartment: in a drawer of the night table beside his bed, she finds pistol. Removes it. There are papers in the same drawer, notes or something. She throws these in the trash. She takes out three letters. As the CAMERA sweeps over on them, we hear her voice:

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ". .thanks for letting me come talk about Gracie. And I'm glad you're willing to admit your temper, and - let's not mince words - the physical abuse you subjected me to." And glances at SECOND LETTER:

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: "Perhaps with your new attitude, we can really work something out. Per your last letter, I'll see you the evening of..." She puts the letters in the drawer where the pistol was. They're not in envelopes; they're loose, open. She picks up the metal detector, resumes her search. The machine beeps insistently around his desk. She can't anything. Finally she discovers a false bottom on one of drawers: a second gun is in there. With the gun are papers: reports from private detectives looking for her, an assessment of his custody rights... She hides the guns in the bottom of the laundry hamper. Finds a photo of herself with Mitch and Gracie. Rips it u Puts the metal detector back in the duffle. Changes into sweatshirt and sweatpants. Takes the distinctive red bag (from the electronics store of the duffle. There's a machine inside. She plugs it in, tucks it behind the couch. Puts her cell phone beside it.     104

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She makes one last check: every wall, surface, every draw Barefoot, she begins to glide around the space. Backing u Moving with ease and grace, sliding deftly to the side as approaches a couch, desk, chair. She's building on her ea reconnaissance: learning where the furniture is and how t navigate around it... DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: LATER. MAGIC HOUR.
dialogues.text: Light fading toward darkness. She's still moving backward only now her sliding is smooth, graceful; almost a dance. As if hearing a distant signal, she slows to a stop. For a long moment she stands perfectly still. Poised. Lik animal in the forest. There's a chair facing the front door. She glances at it. She walks behind the couch, turns off the machine, picks cell phone and auto-dials. GINNY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Slim says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY'S VOICE, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: You okay? SLIM (SOFTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it again. GINNY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say what? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know. What you told me. Beat. On Slim's face as: GINNY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. You have a divine animal right to protect your own life and the life of your offspring. Silence.     105 SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. She hangs up, turns the machine back on and stashes her c phone. With simple ease, she lowers herself onto the chair. Faci the door. Waiting in the fading light... DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch walks down the street. Up the steps, punches in his alarm code. INT. MITCH'S PLACE. NIGHT. Mitch enters, closes and locks the door. Turns on the light. He walks back to the rear of the space, hangs up his coat Goes into the bedroom area, takes off his jacket. The lights go out. Mitch freezes, shadow on shadow, a silhouette in the dark He looks out the window, sees: The neighboring buildings still have light and power. He cocks his head, listening. Silence. Walks to the door of the bedroom area. Waits. Take two more steps - SLIM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me. He nods slowly. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (I thought so.)     106

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves quietly to the bed... to the night table where S found the pistol. Covers this by talking:

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: This morning too? SLIM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always did forget to turn off the coffee. He rummages in the drawer. We hear the RUSTLE of the lett Slim put there. He fails to find the gun. Gives up trying be quiet, tosses papers onto the floor -

dialogues.speaker: SLIM'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I found it, Mitch. His hand leaves the drawer. He thinks. Picks up the phone, listens. Dead. Looks around... can't see her... Goes back to the chair where he hung his sports coat and out his cell phone. We see the GLOW of its dial. He punches 911 and pressed SEND. The dial goes dark for two seconds, then blinks back on. He stares at it. Tries again. 911, SEND. Again it goes dead. SLIM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a machine. Knocks out cell phones. He throws the cell phone onto the bed. Walks out of the bedroom area. Looks around the vast space. Spooky. Slanting light and dense shadow. He doesn't see her.     107

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walks toward his desk. SLIM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found that gun too. He stops. Doesn't know where to go. or what to do. SLIM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scared? MITCH (FUCK YOU)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of what? SLIM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now is when you decide, Mitch. (off his silence) Whether you're a coward. If you are, you can run. I won't stop you. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meaning the match is unfair:) You have my guns. SLIM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Threw 'em away. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then someone's here with you. SLIM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. MITCH (INCREDULOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're alone? SLIM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause it'd be stupid. Silence is her answer.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: You're sayin' this is man to man? SLIM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woman, Mitch.     108 MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I meant: man against woman - you sure that's fair? The lights go back on. Slowly Slim comes out from hiding... SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fair to whom? As he realizes her meaning, she moves into the open area between two couches. She has no weapon. She's barefoot, in her sweats, feet spread for balance, a just slightly raised. Compared to him: she's tiny. He moves toward her. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what you wanted, right? What you were going to San Francisco for: the chance to get me alone? He lunges for her; she slides to the side and he misses. He begins to stalk her. And as he stalks, she moves backward, slowly and graceful the way she was practicing. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand, Slim. How does this work for you? She ignores his words. Watches his eyes and his chest. Wa to know where he's going to attack.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: I mean: this is carefully thought out, right? She does not respond. He throws three punches. None of them hits her. He's unfazed, keeps stalking...     109

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: But say you succeed - beat me up or whatever. You're not going to murder me... (CONT.) Her expression remains neutral, focused. He takes this to be agreement.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: So all you've done is further piss me off. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Self defense is not ,murder. This stops him cold.. He lowers his hands a moment. Stare her, trying to assimilate this new information... MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have the guts. She just looks at him. He blinks, worried for an instant. Covers it with a smile MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not self-defense when you break in here and attack me. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So far you're attacking me. He lunges, almost hits her, rushes in - She has to leap sideways with great speed and dexterity: over the couch to avoid being hit. He also jumps over the couch, but his balance isn't as go and she's waiting for him as he stumbles - With perfect balance and full force, she slugs him in the He goes down. Stays there. For the first time it occurs t him: this might not be easy. He climbs to his feet, feels his nose: blood. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see? I'm just defending myself. He resumes stalking her. Only he's angry now, and it's sc     110 MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you fail, you can count on this: you'll never see Gracie again. She reacts - He sees it, rushes her - Punching as he goes. From the standpoint of pure physics, makes a terrifying force. Until: She steps back, grabs his arm, whips him vs. the brick wa He hits it, bounces off. Cut on his forehead, blood streaming down his face. He stares at her... breathing hard... trying to put it to MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really (think) ...you think you'll kill me and get away with it?l SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you. Self-defense. I came here, as arranged in our letters, to talk about Gracie - MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letters? There are no - SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the drawer where your pistol was. You just left prints all over them. He stares at her, stunned in every way. Touches his foreh feels the blood... SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You attacked me, I fought back. And of course if you never touch me... (SWEET SMILE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have to give myself bruises... He goes berserk. Leaps at her, covering ground quickly wi his long stride, swinging his massive arms. This is the m terrifying form of combat: a huge person attacking a tiny If he should hit her even once, a glancing blow, she will down, she will break, it will be over.     III

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he misses, and misses again. Sometimes his punches ar wild, almost comical. Others come so close we hear-the wi feel their power, feel his sweat on her... CONTINUE this terrifying choreographed dance with destruc for as long as it will hold. At every instant, we fear fo bones and her life. Sometimes she leans back like Muhamma to barely slip a punch, and we see terror on her face, ma to determination. She knows the score. and the odds. Finally, in frustration at so many misses, he grabs an as hurls.it at her - it flies over her head - He punches again and again, wildly. She remains untouched. He stops. With all the blood, he looks like a wild animal He makes a great effort to pull himself together... MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This doesn't bother me, Slim. I don't care how long it takes. We both know: Ionly have to hit you once. Once, and it's over. She laughs at him. This is the last thing he expected and the last thing he stand. He rushes at her again, fast - She starts left - He blocks her way - She starts right - Again he's blocking her - She lunges to the left, through a narrow space - He punches, grazing her hair; punches again, just missing a third time. We feel the awesome power behind these blow She's in the clear again. Smiles casually. Clearly part o her strategy is to keep him angry:     112 SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm confused, Mitchy. Aren't you a man? (QUOTING HIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was "no contest?" I mean, can't you hit me even once? He grabs a lamp, yanks out the cord, wields it like a clu

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: (AMUSED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A weapon? He smashes the lamp down, just missing her head -

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: It's a martial-arts cliche, honey. A weapon throws you off balance - SWISH - SWIPE - SLAM -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He misses her three times, the last time smashing the lam the wall so hard that the impact hurts his hand. He yelps

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: You see? He turns toward her, pain on his face, holding his hand - And she truly attacks for the first time. Smashes her fis against his head - He flies back, bounces vs. the wall. As he comes off it, she punches him again - He roars with rage, lunges at her, head first, great spee She hurtles him in the same direction, increasing speed - Right into the opposite wall. The top of his head hits the wall. He shudders like someone in a cartoon: a spasm running he TOE -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops.     113

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Face down. Does not move. At all. She stares at him. Goes to him. Wary. Gives him a reflex test - No reaction. He's unconscious. She tests his neck for a pulse. Apparently he's still alive, because she raises her hand over her head. Her palm vertical, like a knife. She's about to deliver a karate chop. To his neck. it will break his neck. It will kill him. Her hand stays there, poised. CAMERA PLUNGES IN ON HER FA FLASHES:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Mitch hitting her the first time - - Midwest house, Mitch leaping out from Gracie's doorway - Mitch beating her as she crawls across the floor of their house. (Something we didn't see before.) She reache up, flicks the light switch; Mitch jumps on her back - - Mitch: "You'll never see Gracie again." - Earlier: "She's My daughter. Don't even think about taking her." - Strangling Slim, whispering: "...where you're going, they will never... ever... find you."     114

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SLIM
dialogues.text: Face contorted in rage, confusion - She brings her hand down - Misses. him. Intentionally. Turns away, tears in her eyes. She retrieves her cell phone, turns off the cell-phone bl presses redial. Stares out the window. We see the turmoil on her face, he in her voice: SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't, Gin. GINNY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Re you okay? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. GINNY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're okay?!, you beat him?! SLIM YEAH - GINNY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It worked?! SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me! I did it, but I can't do it! I can't kill him! Behind Slim, out of focus: movement, a soft blur...

dialogues.speaker: GINNY'S VOICE, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: (URGENTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim. He'll come after you - SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know -

dialogues.speaker: GINNY'S VOICE, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: He'll come after Gracie -     115

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An indistinct shape, something rising over her head... SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know all that! I have to, but I can't! I'm not a killer! I'm not him! Mitch. Crazed and bloody face. In his hand: the wooden la She senses something, turns her head slightly to one side - so the lamp does not land quite flush on her skull. Still sends her crashing to the floor. Now she does not move. He stands over her. Looks insane: bloody, dazed, beaten: triumphant. GINNY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Slim? You there? The lamp moving in his hand. He's rotating it. A simple menacing image... . and we realize: he' s aoinq to hit he

dialogues.speaker: GINNY'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Should I call the cops?! Answer me?! He's distracted by Ginny's voice. Picks up the phone. MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me, bitch. Ginny's silent.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: if you value your children, don' t call anybody. It's over, okay? It's all over. He throws the phone on the couch and moves back toward Sl lamp clenched tight in his fist. SMASH IN CLOSE ON HER FACE. CLOSER STILL. We're almost inside her head as we hear: INSTRUCTOR'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold onto my voice...     116

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that the hint of a smile on her face?

dialogues.speaker: INSTRUCTOR'S VOICE, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: You're ready... Mitch sees the slight smile, can't believe it - Rage. He pulls his foot back to kick her - Her eyes are open, just a slit - His foot swinging forward... As it reaches her, she grabs it, yanks it - He's pulled off his feet, crashing down on top of her - But she's already rolling, out from under him... and up - Coming to her feet - He starts to rise, all fours, then into a crouch and ug.. SLOW MOTION. She's ready. Her face alert. Center of gravi low. Arm low,.fist low... As her motion unfurls: Boxers say that an uppercut, perfectly executed, is the most difficult, powerful, and beautiful of punches. Indeed: when an uppercut starts low for maximum center-of gravity and hits the opponent flush on the point of the c as Slim's does here - it delivers a devastating message t central nervous system, short-circuiting it completely. Mitch flies backward... There's a table behind him. His head cracks on the table. His neck snaps. He lands on the floor: twisted, broken. Slim stares at him. There's no way a living man could assume the position now occupied by her former husband.     117

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares in disbelief. Though she knows the answer, she feels his carotid artery Her face registers what she feels. Horror, relief. She walks slowly to her cell phone, picks it up. Listens: no one there. She presses redial, waits... GINNY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a panic) H o?d SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. GINNY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh thank God you're alive. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gin, he's ...he hit his...he's not breathing. GINNY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oh. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. GINNY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well: I called the cops, they're on their way. Slim nods. GINNY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim... can you hear me?, this is important. Beat. SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. As Ginny talks, Slim puts the cell-phone blocker into the duffle and carries the duffle to the rear of the building GINNY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not him, okay? You're not him, and you never will be.     118 SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you soon. She drops the cell phone out the bedroom window into the Then the duffle. They both sink. EXT. BROWNSTONE. She comes out, sits on the steps. A siren is audible. Cop cars speed down the street, screech to a stop. TWO COPS LEAP OUT OF THE CAR, run toward her. FIRST COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? She looks at him, considering the question. Shakes her head. FIRST COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? She makes a slight motion to indicate that Mitch is insid the OTHER COP runs into the apartment. Slim lowers her head. First Cop looks at her, sees the blood on her scalp. FIRST COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you're one of the lucky ones. She looks up, stares at him, and starts to cry. SMASH INTO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim jumping up and down and generally making a fool of h as Gracie runs off the plane into her arms. Ginny follows her own kids; hugs all around -

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER GATE AT THE AIRPORT. DAY.
dialogues.text: Slim looking... waiting... seeing: Joe. He hurries to her and picks up Gracie instead, gives Gracie a big hug. Joe lingers in the hug as Slim waits...and waits... Finally he turns to Slim, hint of a smile: JOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What rules are we playing by now? She answers him with the kind of kiss you can get away wi a bar or airport and almost nowhere else.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER GATE AT AIRPORT. DAY.
dialogues.text: Jupiter comes off the plane, is hugged by Ginny, shakes h with Joe. As he turns to Gracie, Slim says: SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time be nice to her. JUPITER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it gonna be like that? SLIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Jupiter smiles, shakes hands with Gracie: JUPITER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope I can work into being your grandfather, okay? Gracie shrugs. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIGNS all over: OPEN AGAIN AFTER BOMBING1 SAME GREAT FOOD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim, Joe, Jupiter, and Gracie eating, Ginny serving larg platters of gorgeous food:     120 GINNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So whattaya say, Slim-girl, you comin' back to work? PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (passing by, overhears and JUMPS IN:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After all I do for her... ? She better not! Ginny gives him a look - PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has to go back to school, make big success. Sigmund Freud, yes?! (PATS JUPITER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Mr. Moneybags will pay. Jupiter gives Phil a playful look: thanks a lot. Phil whispers to Gracie: PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But don't let her cook, huh Gracie? You eat here all the time. Gracie nods thanks, whispers back: GRACIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me Queen Elizabeth. RUN TITLES ON THE REST OF THEIR MEAL. The longer it runs, happier this odd family (including Ginny and Phil) seems. FADE OUT.
